Reviews.Title: “Elegance Defined”
Reviews.Author: aikoaikoallday
Reviews.Content: We spent three great nights at the Grand Flora. To start with, the location was superb. We saw every typical tourist sight there is, and never took a cab. With that said, the hotel is not in too busy an area. The rooms are spacious by European standards, kept very clean and are maintained well. The staff was professional and helpful. The management of this hotel is firt class. Bottom line - stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased with this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LRDoc
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on trip advisor. I was originally scheduled to stay at another well know hotel that the reviews were not so good so I changed to this property. I loved my room. Reception and check in were excellent. In room dinning and the Cabiria Restaurant had great food and service. All good!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: IlbertManor
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed at the hotel for 4 nights abd 5 days! we absolutely loved our warm stay. The staff was kind, warm and hospitable. We loved the rooms! they were typical english rooms. It was our honeymoon so, we loved the cosy feel of the place. We had a great time. The complimentary breakfast was also well arranged and delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Great property, somewhat distant location”
Reviews.Author: Nikki B
Reviews.Content: The folks that work here are so great. Very accommodating, kind and helpful. I got the free breakfast with my upgrades. The room is typical European size, but the real issue is the location. Harry's Bar is great across the street and the Spanish steps are a short walk but any of the other "touristy" destinations are going to be somewhat of a walk. I love a long walk and exploring, but for others hoping for quick easy trips it may not be the ideal situation. I did not use the Metro, but there is a metro stop less than 4 blocks away - very close!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lettergirl40
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Italy in February. We stayed at this hotel using points. We were upgraded to a suite. The room was a corner room in the from of the hotel. We were one floor below the rooftop restaurant. So we had the smells of bacon and coffee every morning. Also, breakfast was included with our stay. It was a large spread with eggs, meats, cheeses, breads, fruits and juices. The staff at this hotel were very helpful. They were really helpful with reservations and updates on closings since we were there during the snow storm. Our views from our hotel room looked over the Villa Borghese. The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean. It was a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “One of Romes Secrets”
Reviews.Author: MercuryChocolates
Reviews.Content: 9.99/10 ~ Food, atmosphere, service beyond description. This place has it all.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Stay”
Reviews.Author: Pompey103
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for our 11th wedding anniversary. The location is great, at the top of Via Vento. We were only in Rome for 24 hours so didn't experience alot. However, this hotel is definately one to consider. We were upgraded to a junior suite, which was very spacious, bathroom slightly small, but functioned fine. Room over looked the street and the nearby gardens. As usual Marriott Bed - so truly comfortable. Breakfast was in the rooftop restaurant. Not the best breakfast in the world (give the porridge a skip) but view was amazing and service was great. I'd recommend you consider here if you want to stay in Rome & are looking for luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!!”
Reviews.Author: LorenaMas
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is bit pricier than others, it's truly an excellent choice if you are traveling with your kids. We recently traveled with our 15 & 11 yr. old kids. They were happy to get an "american" size room with a huge sitting area (presidential suite). The staff was incredibly helpful and professional. The location was ideal. We were close to the park and a beautiful part of Rome that was just a bit away from all the crazy traffic and all the overwhelming tour groups. I would certainly stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: natty3816
Reviews.Content: Earlier this month, my husband and I were fortunate enough to stay at this lovely hotel for 5 nights. We were thrilled with its location, right on the Via Veneto, inside the old wall, with many dining options in the evenings. We had a fantastic suite, with a balcony overlooking the city and the Via Veneto. This is an old hotel, that is in perfect condition. Rooms and public areas are immaculate. The staff is very helpful and professional. We really enjoyed the excellent breakfast every morning, that was made especially nice, by being able to eat outside, and enjoy the views. The breakfast staff was particularly good. This is a great hotel, in a wonderful location.

Reviews.Title: “Roma's Grand Flor is Truly Grand”
Reviews.Author: Bob P
Reviews.Content: The Grand Flora is an old style hotel that has been made over to provide all of the modern amenities. This is one of the very few Category 8 hotels in the Marriott chain. It is located in one of the most scenic areas of Rome and is conveniently located to many of the sights that most visitors would want to see. The service was fantastic. Everyone form the doormen to the concierge could not have ben more helpful as they went out of their way to make this a most pleasant stay. We would higly recommend this hotel to anyone considering a visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but very expensive”
Reviews.Author: BPreston310
Reviews.Content: This is one of Marriott's category 8 properties and was very happy to use points to stay here. I arrived via train and took a cab to the hotel. I can't recall the amount but it was reasonable. This is a VERY nice Marriott and you feel very worldly staying here. I was glad to be dressed up upon check in! Hotel staff friendly and no issues with check in. Concierge was helpful and provided good intel on the local attractions. Rooms were very small by US standards, but this is Italy. My room was very clean, quiet, and comfortable. Can't say the view was good although when staying on points you rarely get anything good these days. That is a Marriott issue, not the hotel itself. Used room service for a light snack and the food was delivered promptly. Many of the tourist attractions are close and there's ample shopping and dining near the hotel. The concierge lounge was really nice with rooftop seating. It was a cold day during my stay, but I did venture out for some pictures. Breakfast was really good with many American and European options. I would recommend the hotel due to its location and because it is a really nice property. Even better recommendation if you have Marriott points. When in Rome, right? Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: ToniV1
Reviews.Content: First time we have ever stayed anywhere on points and were made to feel guilty. Husband is a lifetime Marriott Platinum. I had to reserve 2 rooms as virtually all Marriotts in Europe will not allow 3 in a room on points. I wrote the hotel asking for an early check in if possible. I also asked for 2 rooms close together or the one upgrade to a Jr. Suite which would have allowed my husband, daughter and I to stay together. I explained to the hotel it was our first trip since the death of our oldest daughter and we would like to be together. Not only did we not get an early check in (I guess I didn't really except an early check in although it was low season and the hotel was nowhere near full), our rooms were not ready at the normal 2:00 checkin time. We finally got in one room at 4:00. Our daughter's room next door was still not clean. We were told, even though we booked 2 rooms we would have to pay for our daughter's breakfast..a first. The room was teeny, no platinum upgrade on second floor and the view was the wall of a building and there was no bathtub, only a shower. I called reception 3 times about the room and kept being told it was all they had. Finally I requested to speak to the manager. I was very nice and explained the situation. We were upgraded to a suite, but were told they would keep both certificates (total of 320,000 points). Obviously there was a better room available and as a Platinum we should have been upgraded. The hotel is beautiful and the view from a decent room. outstanding. The breakfast staff is very good, but the breakfast is below average for a hotel of this statute. The front desk staff remained pretty rude. We stayed 4 nights and left the hotel at 9 am to catch a train to Naples.I got out my wallet before we left and got out the train tickets. When I got on the train and unzipped my purse my wallet was not there, I left it in the room. We got to Naples in an hour and went through the luggage and the wallet was not there. I called the hotel and they said the room had not been cleaned and they would go check and call back. After 30 minutes we called them and were curtly told the wallet was not there. When we got to our hotel in Sorrento we went through the luggage again, no wallet. We called the hotel again and begged them to check again and call us back. After an hour we called them. Of course by now the room is not only cleaned, but rented and we were curtly told no wallet. The wallet HAD to be left in the room. Yes, we stayed on points, but have never been made to feel guilty for this. We heard a couple having breakfast who arrived that morning and they were on points, given an upgrade to a suite and offered breakfast the day they checked in and had their room at 8 am, but they were British. We were very nice up to the point of no effort on the wallet. Also the beds are very hard and uncomfortable not up to Marriott standards or the standard of a high quality hotel. I RARELY write bad reviews, but Marriott Grand Flora deserves one.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Flora, perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: OmarTraveller
Reviews.Content: I really like the location of this hotel, it's not too close to the tourist spots, but it's not far either. The surrounding restaurants and places open until reasonable hours, which is great. Nice rooms and service, not too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely beautiful!!”
Reviews.Author: lenore D
Reviews.Content: This hotel not only met my expectations but exceeded them. The room was spacious and immaculate. The linens were so white and clean. The staff were all extremely helpful and responsive. I think it took 10 minutes to receive our room service orders. Everything was perfect. The breakfast on the rooftop terrace to the lounge in the lobby were incredible. We had no problems at all. If I ever return I will absolutely stay again, 8 nights was not enough!! If your contemplating like I was between and Italian chain or an American chain stick with the Marriott. It was absolutely outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Marriott”
Reviews.Author: halaka
Reviews.Content: For European standards, this is a pretty grand place to stay. Close to Trevi fountain and the pantheon. I would second guess the recommendations of the staff as they give you convenient touristy restaurants instead of jewel finds. But I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Value with Style”
Reviews.Author: hope4one
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for our business travel group. Marriott Grand Flora met our expectations in all categories: Close proximity to the airport (40 Euro or less by Taxi), easy walking distance to the center of Rome via Metro tunnel (across the street), comfortable rooms, large bed, stylish rooms with good working area. Breakfast buffet included and a reasonable internet fee (9 Euro for 7 days). Professional staff and helpful Concierge. Rates are competitive and Marriott has the edge with this hotel. Our next hotel reservation will be at the Grand Flora on our return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: papandnon
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 10 days in Rome. We stayed at the Marriott Grand Flora.In all our years of travel,and we are in our Seventies,We could not have been treated any better. The concierge was wonderful to us. Helped us with calling our cousins who lived in Rome and didn't speak English. The service people were great---greated us every morning at breakfast with a big smile and couldn't have been nicer. Also, were very nice in the lounge . The hotel location was absolutely perfect....We would stay there again with no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: WTB1013
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect, the room was clean and nice. My review for this hotel would be better but the concierge staff really were not good. I had asked for a dinner at an authentic Italian restaurant and was directed to a really poor restaurant full of American tourists. It was terrible and when I complained the front desk staff mocked me and said I was not going to find any hotel in Rome without American Tourists. Using my guidebook - I was able to find several restaurants where I was indeed the only American in the room - which was welcomed. If you stay here and they advise you to go the restaurant around the corner - tell them no thanks unless you want a subpar experience at a very high price. As a Marriott Gold member, I would not stay at this hotel again given the quality of the front desk staff and would recommend other hotels in the area (the Westin) instead.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Norma_H_12
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is wonderful. The room was beautiful. The bed was very comfortable. We would highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Quiet Room”
Reviews.Author: FromToronto2011
Reviews.Content: The staff could not be more accommodating. Large well appointed room with king bed. Food in restaurant was excellent. Definitely will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Nam S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Flora in early Dec and it was definitely one of the best hotels during our entire vacation in Italy. The room though a little small by US standards, was clean and beautiful with all the amenities expected from a hotel of this ranking. The staff was extremely helpfull with every request and we loved our breakfasts at the roof top terrace. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone planning a trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid”
Reviews.Author: wazza1979
Reviews.Content: Myself and my family stayed here for a second time (first being without kids) and it was perfect. We had a suite which was fantastic and spacious and enough room for us all. The kids got a little present each and we also got a bottle of champagne and chocolates for us adults in our room. The staff are also great especially Marco who organised everything for us. Overall a great stay and will definiately be back.

Reviews.Title: “American Hotel”
Reviews.Author: beverly v
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels in Rome, great location! The staff was wonderful! If you was american amenities in Italy stay here. It is within walking distance of historic Rome just down the street from the American Embassy and across the street from the Borgese Gardens

Reviews.Title: “Staying in this hotel might be addictive! :)”
Reviews.Author: Petrita99
Reviews.Content: I was impressed by this hotel from all aspects. I had the most amazing sleep in my life here. The bed was so comfortable, pillows were like from the TV advert. The curtains were those heavy ones which give you a feeling that is a night even it is a lunch time. The breakfast place in the top floor has a terrace with breathtaking views. It is conveniently located in walking distance from all Roman sightseeing hot spots. It is not a cheap hotel but definitely worth. I can't imagine anyone would get disappointed here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with great service”
Reviews.Author: NjLovetraveling
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days first week of December. This is a great location for a visitor to Rome. We usually walked from the hotel to sight see or to eat. If we needed a taxi there is a taxi stand right out the front door to the right. We did have drinks one evening in the bar which was rather quiet and relaxing after a long day of seeing the sights. We had the breakfast buffet one morning and that was the only negative that we have about this Marriott. The buffet was priced high and the quality of food was not even average. We decided on tea and cold cereals. The view from the breakfast room is absolutely beautiful!!! Our room was always clean and very comfortable. All the staff was very helpful and friendly!!!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star for Italy and 5 Star for This High Rent Area”
Reviews.Author: Foodie8_4U
Reviews.Content: If you want true 5 star service and standards you are used to in Asia.....don't go to Rome. This hotel is simply the best quality and overall value for Rome. I have stayed all over the Via Vittorio Veneto (think the set of La Dolce Vita) and the Marriott wins everytime. First, realize that all of the top Italian hotels put all their money into the lobby...they all look great from the outside. The rooms are often a much different story. Second...the is the Manhattan of Rome...so unless you are willing to spend $3000 a night for a room, you will get a 4 and even a 3 star experience in most of these tired old properties even when you spend $400+ a night. But remember...it is Roma!! Dont spend time in your room!!! Explore and eat and stay out late. Here is one downside of this (and most high end) Marriotts....at peak season they are full of loud, obnoxious, large American housewives with 2+ iPhone disinterested teenagers in tow and a beaten down corporate exec husband who paid for the entire trip with frequent flyer miles and then Marriott miles. They moan and groan and complain about EVERYTHING and this is their "payback" for a year of being abandoned by their world trotting hard working husbands -- who are all platinum elite status. They want everything free and they are highly resentful that their spouse gets to escape from the soccer mom life all year for places like Rome, Bangkok, Sydney, etc...surrounded by fun, young, hot women. So....leave your fat wife at home....bring a smile, shoulder shrug and love of all things Italian and Rome and this Marriott will be the BEST decision you could make. Old but spotless clean with VERY good staff who are exceptionally helpful....even to loud complaining spouses.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, absolutely nothing wrong with the stay”
Reviews.Author: HoustonConsultant
Reviews.Content: Stayed here using Marriott points for three days this summer. Arrived earlier than the standard check-in, and our original room was not ready. The front desk staff was very nice and offered a non-view room that was available, but then worked hard and found us a room with a view. All of the staff we met were extremely helpful. Breakfast buffet was included in our room rate, and it was standard for European hotel breakfasts. We were doing a morning tour of the Vatican and just wanted a soda to go, and they brought out two sodas and a small box so that we could take muffins with us. The room was small for US standards, but pretty typical for Europe, and the quality was that of a good Marriott, so no surprises there. Location is a short walk to the Spanish Steps, and a long walk to the Forum and things on that side of town. It is not a posh hotel, but it is a quality Marriott, and everything about the stay was just fine.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good location”
Reviews.Author: marc c
Reviews.Content: Disappointed when we arrived at noon and was told a room would be available in 10 minutes and it took an hour. The room was nice except the carpet was pretty worn and needed an engineer to fix the TV. Location is just a few blocks from the hop on hop off bus which we used for 2 days. The breakfast buffet was very good as was the restaurant adjoining the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, but nice”
Reviews.Author: Erik Z
Reviews.Content: Very nice location; the Via Veneto is the Roman equivalent of Rodeo Drive in Hollywood, or the Champs Elysee in Paris. Very expensive shops in the area. It's not in the center of all the touristic sites, but not too dreadfully far from a metro station either through which you can access the rest of Rome. The rooms are rather small, but nicely decorated. The bed was fairly comfortable. The staff was very friendly and attentive to requests. The music in the bar was rather loud, which made conversation somewhat difficult.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and professional”
Reviews.Author: HelleKrog
Reviews.Content: We had not planned to go to this hotel so we did not have any expectations. All in all it was a very nice and pleasant experience. Rumors about arrogant Romans offering poor service do not emerge from this hotel. The staff is very professional, smiling and always helpful. We had just spent a terrible night at a dreadful hotel in Fiuggi south west of Rome, and coming to the Marriott Grand Flora was such a relief. Itl was the exact opposite of the other hotel in Fuiggi (Hotel Sliva Splendid). Maybe we were easy to please, but we really enjoyed everything about this hotel (did miss free internet access in the room though). The loacation is great – on Via Veneto, close to the Villa Borghese garden and the Spanish Steps. A nice quiet corner compared to the crowded streets close to the Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona, Termini etc. Conclusion: Highly reccommend.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth K
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in November. This is just an average hotel in my opinion - not great and not terrible. I am a conference planner, so I stay in a lot of hotels. This one did not seem up to Marriott standards, nor worthy of the hefty price tag, in my opinion. The rooms were a bit tired and could use a refresher. The carpet was really worn. The pillows were terrible - they were actually lumpy (which I can say I have never experienced before!). Bathroom was fine. The buffet breakfast was a total ripoff for 30 euro (but it does have a great view). We got a 2-for-1 coupon, but I would not go back. Totally not worth it - go down the street to the Westin and go to their coffee bar. We got croissants and coffee there for about 6 euro total. The Marriott did not seem to have a cafe - just the main restaurant. Location of this hotel is good - we could walk to the Spanish Steps area. The staff at the Marriott were friendly. The concierge was helpful when we arrived, and the doorman was always pleasent. Housekeeping was fine - no complaints. So, overall, it was fine. But I would choose another hotel in Rome if I went back. This one was nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: ChristofG
Reviews.Content: It is rated a five star hotel and the first appearance is really great. Doorman, helpful staff at the front desk and a very luxurious appearance. Finding the room is a different story. I got a room I had to find in the background of the hotel. I did ask for a quiet room... Ok depending what are you used to but having the trash cans in front of the window and same is true for the taxi cue. Unfortunately the windows could not been closed. Bathroom: well let me put is this way.. Last renovation is somewhat 20 years ago.... Bar: sorry to bother the batman with the desire of an ordinary espresso... There is a lot of light but some really dark shadows here

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DURANTE0324
Reviews.Content: I just reurned from a great stay at this hotel. The room was nice. The location is excelent. The service was great. A Concierge named Danielle made a dinner reservation for us at Da Bolognse 30 days before our arrival. Another Concierge named Bernardo was very nice, and sent us to some great places. The view at the rooftop at breakfast every morning was fantastic! I will go back.

Reviews.Title: “At the very top of the Via Veneto”
Reviews.Author: Leopard_Lil
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this lovely hotel for only one night, but checked in early in the morning and my room was already ready, so gold star right away. The room was very large and had a huge walk-in closet which had plenty of room for all the suitcases that myself and my sister had brought with us. There was even a charming little hallway, with a device to hang your jacket on. The bathroom was beautifully tiled in a rich green color, but even though all amenities were available, I found it a little short on storage space - nowhere to place your toilet bag, except for either the end of the bath or on a funny little stool that was under the sink. I think if I was staying there for longer than one night, I might get annoyed at not being able to set my things on a shelf somewhere. Another nice touch is that the floor is covered in parquet, as opposed to carpet, so it felt kinda old-world - like being in someone's European apartment and not in a hotel. Breakfast was included in the price I paid and the location of the breakfast buffet was a treat in itself. The restaurant is located on the top floor, with tables inside and outside on a terrace with a view of all of Rome and the Borghese park next door. I could've spent all day up there gazing out. It was perfect. And the food was great as well - we enjoyed a couple of gorgeous tarts with our eggs and toast. All in all, although it is a bit of a trek to walk all the way up the Via Veneto to get back at the end of a day's sightseeing, I would still stay here again, as it really felt like a 'home from home'.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel on Via Veneto”
Reviews.Author: cordelia1988
Reviews.Content: Very pretty hotel on Via Veneto. Our room was an upgrade on the fifth floor. Very large by European standards. Even though it was on the front of the hotel and in the corner we did not have any trouble with street noise. The bathroom was wonderful. Rather expensive. Staff was very good. I would not recommend the breakfast on the terrace. It is expensive and the food is just so so. You can still take in the terrace view by exiting the elevator to the left on the seventh floor. The hotel is not particularly close to Rome's main attractions, but we don't mind walking a little. Everything on Via Veneto is expensive so be aware of that before you stay there. For us, it was worth it.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Manuel Antonio National Park, Costa Rica
Reviews.Title: “Left too much to be desired”
Reviews.Author: Latitud
Reviews.Content: The location was great. The buffet was fantastic. The bed was made out of two twin put together so we had to " mind the gap' all night long. The staff is not service oriented at all. Almost rude, indeed. Not worth the price they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: 558Bertie
Reviews.Content: For our 25th wedding anniversary we traveled to Italy and stayed at this lovely hotel for the last 5 days of our trip. The hotel is really beautiful, our room was spacious, very clean and had a large, modern bathroom. The staff was very helpful and attentive. The breakfast buffet on the rooftop terrace was excellent-it had everything from pancakes and fresh fruit to pastries and meats. The view was amazing. The location was great- very near to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. The concierge was so helpful- lots of recommendations for well priced restaurants and the best way to get everywhere. We had a wonderful stay and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place not sure worth the price?”
Reviews.Author: Bigmocker
Reviews.Content: We stayed there on the last leg of our 18 day vacations through italy. The hotel was nice, the breakfast was excellent, the service was good. We feel the it was over priced for what we got compared to other places. I would stay again if the price was right we paid a 5 star price and got a 3 1/2 star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: MindyPDX
Reviews.Content: We stayed here using Marriott points for our last night in Rome. We found the location to be very convenient. The room was spacious, clean and had that old world charm. The breakfast buffet was fabulous. The dining room is on the top floor overlooking all of Rome. It was absolutely beautiful. And the food was great too :) We would stay here again if we get the chance!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy dolce vita in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Albi_66
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the heart of via Veneto, I have spent there several nights for business, and while I normally tend to favour more modern hotels, in this case I have to say the place mixes old charme and up-to-date services. The lobby offers free wi-fi connection, rooms are normally spacious, staff is kind and very responsive to queries. Breakfast is not amazing, as you normally find in a Marriot hotel, but the local restaurant is however good and well-priced.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a wonderful atmosphereand old-world charm.”
Reviews.Author: Lochindorb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Grand Hotel recently for a conference. Our organisation had used it before and both times everyone commented on the peaceful atmosphere and overall courtesy of the staff. As a conference venue, we couldn't fault it - everything was prepared with a degree of care and the food, although a fixed menu, was delicious. The staff, generally, are exceptional, especially the front desk, bar and restaurant. Be careful when you need a taxi as they don't gather around the hotel and sometimes the wait can be ten minutes, even by request from the concierge. The building has a long history and indeed, as an other reviewer has stated, has a definite old world charm. The bedrooms are quiet, and spacious to a degree and there is great attention to detail. One of the highlights of this hotel is the roof terrace breakfast room which is also used for functions and weddings. In good weather, you can eat outside and take in some wonderful views of the city, especially towards the Vatican and the Villa Borghese. The breakfast buffet is a quality one with a myriad of hot dishes, cold meats, cheeses, fruit and cereal. One word of warning - be careful about eating outside in September as the wasps can be a nuisance. The hotel is very well situated for the Villa Borghese, Spanish Steps, Roma Terminii, and the airport is, in good traffic conditions, just half an hour away. The fixed charge of around €45 makes a taxi good value for 2-3 passengers. By train to Roma Terminii from the airportis OK, but the very long walk from the dedicated platforms to taxis and the subway is a trek - just think of the distances at Heathrow T3 on arrival. Restaurants adjacent to the hotel are pricey and if you want some real atmosphere in the evening, explore the area around Piazza Navona, downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: minesweeper_10
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels we stayed in on our visit to Italy. From the minute you arrive, the staff is amazing - extremely courteous, helpful. The hotel location is very good, in an upmarket neighbourhood, a short walk away from the metro stop. The spanish steps are also a short walk (10 mins) away. The hotel is surrounded by restaurants. Good size rooms (for Italian standards), very well decorated and super comfortable beds. The bathroom are fantastic, with a tub/shower and a separate walk in shower. Very modern and spacious. Breakfast spread is fantastic! Would surely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Grand Flora - Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JERSEYBK
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to Rome and Eastern Med cruise - stayed at the Marriott Grand Flora for 3 nights (Sept 1 - 4th, 2011). All the look and feel of a 5 star hotel - beautiful lobby and great service. My wife is a Platinum member with Marriott which I think helped us get us a king size bed - room was very nice, clean and comfortable however a little "tight" although the bathroom was fairly large. We had a view of a wall of the Burghese gardens and when we looked down, had a view of several large garbage pails in the street. We didn't plan on hanging out in the room looking out of our window so were not too concerned. I've read other reviews that stated it's difficult to get a king size bed here - friends traveliing with us were not able to get a king size so i think this is true. We used Marriott points for the room, and received free breakfasts due to my wife's status - good thing because I'm sure the hotel is expensive and as many people have written. the breakfast is very expensive although the view from the restaurant on top of the hotel is great - although they had a bee problem on the outside deck (not too much they can do about this). Drinks in the bar turned out to be ridiculously expensive - late one night we returned to the hotel, ordered 1 mixed drink, 1 glass of wine, 1 iced tea (non alcoholic) and 1 glass of water - cost 47 euro (approx $ 65.00 US). Hotel is in great location downtown - as many have stated, very close to major attractions. Overall, very nice hotel if you are willing to pay the price - just have breakfast somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: rich19671
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days in August. Very nice hotel with all the conveniences of American hotels. The room was a bit on the small side but very nice. Short walk to the Spanish steps and lot's of good restraunt choices near by. Would definitely saty here again.

Reviews.Title: “Such a gorgeous, elegant hotel with superb service”
Reviews.Author: Anne C
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive at the Grand Flora Hotel on Via Veneto, you know that you are at one of Marriott's premier hotels. The doormen are so polite and accommodating. You enter an elegant hotel, beautifully decorated with a lovely marble staircase. We traveled with our two teenage sons, and we had two Superior rooms on the second floor. We only used the stairs which were so convenient. The rooms were of a nice size, the beds were very comfortable, and the bathrooms, while not very large, were of beautiful marble and were very clean. The breakfast buffet and the view from the rooftop was incredible! We were spoiled by the wonderful selection of eggs, meats, cheeses, pastries and more. You can walk to the Spanish Steps. I did walk to Piazza Navona, but it was a very long walk. To get to the Vatican, take a cab or walk down Via Veneto to the Barberini Station to take the train to the Vatican/St. Peter's Square. Via Veneto remains a beautiful avenue to stay on, and should we return to Rome, we would return to the Grand Flora Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite Marriott Standards”
Reviews.Author: ChitownCF
Reviews.Content: The location on the Via Veneto is fine across from Harry's Bar. The rooms are small and the breakfasts are not very good. Staff was informative and helpful, but the hotel is not what we have come to expect from Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stays!”
Reviews.Author: cup-of-jo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel several times during recent trips to Rome. The staff is wonderful and the hotel is beautiful!! The front desk staff speak several languages, including English. The rooms are well appointed & large by European standards. The terrace is closed for much of August, but is scheduled to re-open in September. It offers a breathtaking view of Rome. The breakfast has moved to downstairs cafe for now, with many choices for the hot or cold selections. As one poster mentioned, the eggs are not as "thick" as in the US, but this was consistent with my experiences at many other European hotels - this one also offered an omelet type selection on the buffet as well. There was a wide selection of juices, coffees, teas, prosecco, & water. The buffet has two sections & there were a lot of choices, so you shouldn't go away hungry. It is a short walk to Barberini station. The entrance to Spagna station looks like it is across the street, BUT it is actually a longer walk to the station itself than Barberini. There is a small grocery station inside this metro though & it has good prices. I used this station to walk to/from the Spanish Steps a few times, especially when it was really hot out. Termini station is a short cab ride away if you are in a hurry or don't want to take the metro (6-8 euro). If you are interested in the Hop-On, Hop-Off buses, there is a stop nearby. I saw them coming by at regular intervals. The concierge can also set up private tours of Rome & the rates were reasonable and even better than comparable services. There is also a Mail Box Etc across the street. Several embassies are nearby, including the American Embassy down the street. If you are walking down Via Ludovisi, look at the beautiful Swiss Institute on the left, it has a nice grotto in the front. They offer tours, but are closed until September. There are a lot of shops & restaurants nearby too. The food in hotel restaurant was delicious and prices were reasonable. Please remember that this is Rome - the staff look to you for direction, so let them know when you are ready for the check (this applies to all dining in Rome). The dining staff is around if you need anything & will check-in periodically, but they do not push themselves on you every few minutes like in the US. Even when they were wrapping up for the evening, and they are open late, I never felt rushed. To me, it was dining as it was supposed to be. The service was consistent; the staff went out of their way to ensure everything I needed was accommodated.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wrok
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights. The hotel is a beautiful old hotel. Similar to those in San Francisco or Washington DC. Beautifully appointed, clean and with a great view of the area. The elevator is very small. The staff were most accommodating and checked us in early and promptly. The internet and Wifi service was great. Breakfast was included, but the American version is not good. Eggs were runny and most of the food was cold. The European breakfast was very good. The dinning terrace was closed when we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: TunicaBaby
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome for three nights. The staff was attentive, the rooms were well appointed and our experience was wonderful. The only complaint I have was that coffee wasn't available in the room and their coffee service (in the lobby) was only available from 6-9 AM. We had a Junior Suite so that we could all fit into one room together. We looked at other hotels and most seemed to have really small rooms and it was harder to find accommodations for more than two people than in the US. The hotel is in a nice part of town. The walk to the metro (subway) was about 7 minutes and there are lots of restaurants, shops and cafes nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms - mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: DeuxCarr
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at the Marriott Flora as we loved our previous visit so much. This time we were allocated a tiny room - albeit well decorated - with a view of a brick wall. Staff were rude, unsmiling and clearly would rather being doing other things than assisting guests. We had a private dinner on the roof terrace which offers stunning views over the city (breakfast is also served there) but the food was terrible. We ate in a local restaurant the following night for the same price and the entire experience was oustanding. Breakfast is good but again they are bad with even the most basic tasks (clearing tables, bringing coffee etc). The hotel is in a great location which is its main selling point. I am sure your (large amount of) money would be better spent elsewhere and I have to say that mine will be on my next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location with 5* service”
Reviews.Author: Frank107
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Flora for 4 days at the beginning of our trip to Italy and 2 days at the end of our 3 week vacation. The hotel is perfectly located on the beautiful Via Venetto street where you can eat, shop and or just take a nice walk. The hotel is a 5 minute walk to the Spanish Steps, and from there a few minutes more walk to the shopping street of Via Del Corso and sites to see such as the Trevi Fountain, Pantheon and other spectacular churches. Its also at the entrance of the a park called Villa Borghese. We rented bikes for a couple of Euros and had a great morning ride with my wife and 12yr daughter. Service was 5*... the hotel took great care of to ensure we has a great stay, from the check-in staff to the restaurant staff (we had breakfast included). We needed a roll-in bed for my daugther which i forgot to mention on the reservation and they set it up within minutes of check-in apologizing to me - for my mistake! The roof-top restaurant is spectacular for breakfast. Great views of the Vatican and the park. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stat”
Reviews.Author: marcel dam
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend here whilest my wife was in Italy for business outside the city. The reception was great we felt relly welcome. Staff very helpfull and friendly. The room was nice, overlooking the via vento and not noisy. The bathroom was very nice. room was not big but very comfortable. Breakfast was great, good food while overlooking the city from the roofterras. good capucinos. Bar was very welcoming with good service also while sitting outside late in the evening. No complains here! Wwe while return for sure when my wife has to to be in Italy again for work.

Reviews.Title: “The best of Rome”
Reviews.Author: MJandHANK
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Rome, and being a Marriott guest in the US we knew we would be treated in the same quality...... and we not disappointed. We stayed before our Mediterrean cruise and afterwards, as well. The front desk was always helpful. The people friendly. You must have a meal in the roof top restaurant. Eat out side and just take in all of Rome... When we return to Rome, we will go back to the Grand Flora Marijane & Hank

Reviews.Title: “Marriott rarely disappoints”
Reviews.Author: emmi16
Reviews.Content: As usual I enjoyed my stay at the Marriott. I've stayed many of their properties all over the world and you really can't go wrong. My room was small and expensive by American but that seems to be pretty typical in Europe. The furnishings were somewhat outdated but maybe it was designed that way to look historic. The bed was a decent size for just 1 person(full size) and pretty comfortable. I just love the turndown service every evening and the chocolates the housekeeper leaves on the bed. As I wanted the Marriott provides all the little things I need/want and are usually standard in the higher end hotels that I want to stay in. I can't think of what it's called but there wasone of those clothing stands to hang up my clothes so they were ready for the next day. That was a nice touch that not all Marriotts/ hotels always provide. Had all the toiletries I needed. It saved me from having to bring it all with me. The bathroom was pretty spacious compared to the small room and was reasonably well decorated and pleasant to use look/at. The only issue was that after the 1st night housekeeping forgot to provide washcloths. That was annoying as I was about to shower only to find no washcloths, had to get re-dressed & call housekeeping to bring some & then wait. The subway is a bit of a hike from the hotel but the neighborhood is nice and I enjoyed some nice(but expensive) meals at the many restsurants nearby.There's a restaurant somewhere on the same street as the Barbarini station that has great tiramisu if you like that kind of thing. The hotel staff was average considering that customer service that goes above andbeyond is very rare these days. I was on my last several days of my trip and had experienced quite a bit of poor service- the staff here did there jobs as I would expect especially at this price point. I would stay again if I'm in Rome. I actually stopped by a couple of the other hotels in the area that I considered. As usuall this was the best choice for me in terms of convenience, location, reward points, and this was actually more economical than the other options I considered. A view fr my room isn't important to me so I didn't care that I didnT have one from my room.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: kerrwoman007
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five night stay. It is an old classic hotel with lots of marble and traditional features. If you want a sleek, modern place this is not it. The lobby was nice and the service was very good. Our room was large with a king bed, desk, and two chairs. The bathroom was large and clean. We were in the front corner so there was some traffic noise but didn't bother us. The only reason I would not give it an excellent review is that the carpet in our room was beautiful at one time but now needs to be replaced and was actually coming apart in one area. The rooftop breakfast buffet was amazing! Great food and a view of the whole city including the Vatican and St. Peter's Basilica. The location is close to the metro and right next to the Borghese Gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive with quite small rooms and average service”
Reviews.Author: stefano32
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location in via Veneto, the outside is great. The problem is that if you expect the usual Marriott's standard you will be negatively surprised. The room are quite small for the price you are required to pay, the service is average and the lobby is quite small. You can't say that the hotel is not good but for sure is not a good quality / price ratio. FOr the same prices you can probaply find better solution in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on the renowned Via Veneto. World class staff was memorable.”
Reviews.Author: TravelingAllCreation
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights following a couple business meetings in Siena. I was thoroughly impressed with the accomodating staff and the comforts of the room were among the best in Europe. Highlights include: Plusses: * Phenomenal staff. I booked a single that I knew would be small, but since I was extending my business trip for a few days to enjoy the leisure of room on my own, I did not mind a small room. However, it was not only small, but directly overlooked the large trash bin in the courtyard. I went to the front desk and explained that altough the size was not an issue, I did not want my first memories of Rome to be of a large trash bin. They were booked but asked me to leave my luggage at my room door the next morning, and they would put me somewhere else when I returned from sightseeing the next day. Wow!!! Was I surprised when they upgraded me to a very spacious room that was 3x my original room size. Moreover, it was on a high floor and overlooked the Via Veneto rather than the courtyard. In addition, it was one of only a couple rooms that had a full balcony. The three nights in that room were spent in great comfort. Such an upgrade, at no incremental cost to me, exemplified the effort the hotel staff extends to make their guests stay memorable. * Room was very comfortable, and even luxurious. * Common areas are well kept and exude a premium setting. * Location. Easy walking distance to the Trivi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. Plus if you love to shop (I do not), you will revel in the shopping aloing the Via Veneto. Drawbacks. * None. My entire experience was among the best I have ever had at a 5 star property. Thoughts on Rome: Definitely see the tourist sites, but also make time to relax over lunch and dinner. Weather permitting, sit outside and watch the world go by. Soak up the rich Roman experience and enjoy these experiences with a good glass of red wine (which need not be expensive). Walk leisurely from the Trivi Fountain to the Pantheon and enjoy the history of that walk. Then enjoy a nice meal in the Piazza that abuts the Pantheon and watch the moon rise above. It is a special experience, even when traveling solo as I was that long weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great views, delightful staff, grumpy managers”
Reviews.Author: brewski59
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Grand Flora for five nights in early June. We had two rooms - one for my wife and I, one for our two sons (18, 20). We walked nearly the entire city from this excellent location over the course of our stay. We were greeted in the manner one would expect at a Marriott Level 8 property - with graciousness and efficiency - by Anna Rosa at Reception. Even though we were staying on points, we were treated in grand style. Anna Rosa profusely apologized for not having a room upgrade for us (our trip coincided with the Italian National Holiday - the place was buzzing with VIP's). We found our rooms to be delightful nonetheless, and the interior courtyard views actually helped ward off the noise from the street. The linens were top notch, the bath amenities splendid, the bed was quite comfortable and no smoke smell in the room which is a delight in Europe. We took advantage of the Breakfast Buffet every day. The views from the rooftop terrace are simply stunning. Although the items did not change that much, there were so many things to choose from it never really was an issue. The service was either great or lacking depending upon the day. We were spoiled by the hostess every day, and by Rita and Delannia on their days working. The other waitstaff seemed preoccupied with the hovering manager (really tall young guy). These distractions were exacerbated when the older well-tanned gentleman (general manager?) hovered as well. He just seemed to make the younger manager and the staff even more uptight. After watching a few days, I'd suggest they let the capable staff do their job and not direct them so overbearingly. Maybe they could even lend a hand (or schedule another person! But nonetheless, we were quite satisfied with breakfast. Grumpy managers won't spoil our memories of this wonderful hotel. We walked as far as the Pantheon one day, the Colosseum another, saving taxis for a trip to the Vatican and to the train station. We enjoyed the large park just the other side of the old city walls. The food was much more reasonable the farther we got from the hotel, so we enjoyed dinner and stroll each evening. We also took the fast train to Florence on our last day - which was a great break in the action. On our departure, Silvia at Reception sent us away with graciousness and warm wishes, and Anna Rosa stopped over to apologize again for not having a room upgrade. We would highly recommend the hotel to persons wanting an upscale experience in a beautiful location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a central part of town”
Reviews.Author: vdoran
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel which I've stayed at in the past. It is centrally located to a number of sites and in a relatively quiet area. The rooms are nice, the roof top dining has a great view, and the staff is helpful. I particularily want to compliment the various concerige(s) for their help in attempting to locate a bag that EasyJet seemed to have but just wasn't sure where. (I never did get the bag after 7 days of fruitless discussions with EasyJet).

Reviews.Title: “Worst Marriott ever”
Reviews.Author: richmoo1
Reviews.Content: Poor Service. Small cramped rooms. Lots of road noise on lower floors Overpriced In a restricted driving area. Got a ticket for driving to the hotel that took a year to work out. Hotel employees never mentioned driving restriction Complained to Marriott and got no response.

Reviews.Title: “Best.”
Reviews.Author: Sobotta67
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Grand Flora a number of times and over the years have witnessed a little fluctuation. I am glad to report this recent visit proved me it is indeed back to its best. Everything from the bedroom to the breakfast buffet was absolutely perfect. The rooms are extremely comfortable, clean and well decorated. Service is so good I have to personally name Stefana and Marco, who along with the concierge Massimo went (REALLY) out of their way and through a lot of trouble to grant my every wish, even in a time when they were fully booked. Massimo is a real asset to the Hotel himself. I specially recommend this hotel to Americans due to the size of its rooms (similar to US hotels and way larger than other hotels in Rome), service and quality of the breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it when using Marriott points!”
Reviews.Author: go1go2gogone
Reviews.Content: Traveled with my husband and teenage son on vacation... we were 10 nights in Italy, and Rome was our last 5 nights, using our Marriott points. Marco and front desk were outstanding to us. The hotel was very full when we arrived, and even though our room on the first night was fine, they were very gracious and moved us to a larger room with a larger bathroom, and with beautiful views for our last 4 nights, and generously included the rooftop breakfast for our stay, even though our Marriott status didn't warrant it. It truly completed the end of our trip with a bang and flourish! After reading some reviews and realizing location of hotel in a posh area, I was a bit concerned about possibly being snubbed at this hotel, not arriving in the most chic of style after a full day of sightseeing and driving upon entrance. My worries were put to rest --- Everyone at the front desk for the entire stay made every endeavor to be the most helpful they could be --- they went above and beyond. The only downside (for them!) is they almost seemed overworked.... I noticed many of them worked extremely long hours, and seemed to be there when we left in the morning, and when we returned in the evening. Big credit to them for maintaining their professionalism and helpfulness even with the long hours. Each encounter with the concierge desk was very helpful also, and they were very nice and efficient. We never did ask for restaurant guidance (got that from other sources), but they were great booking reservations for us (which by the way, it seemed at both restaurants we used that for, the Flora carried weight) and giving directions. More kudos I would like to give, is to the rooftop restaurant at breakfast each morning. They were extremely hardworking, pleasant, gracious and obviously tried very hard to please everyone. If there wasn't something, they would get it for you. It was SUCH a pleasure starting each day there with a leisurely breakfast and gorgeous views and great service. As far as the room, the king-size bed was great, extremely comfortable (I'm picky), and my son's single bed they had brought in was better made up than any hotel I've been in for a rollaway/extra bed! The shower was wonderful, with a rain head and an extremely powerful handheld, and heated towel bars. The amenities were also great... good shampoos and soaps, lotion and mouthwash. Always more than enough towels, and they were great towels. The bathroom was spotlessly clean. Here are a few tiny downsides, not enough counting off for, as nothing is perfect, but worth a mention. Our room either wasn't vacuumed every day or not vacuumed well... I had dropped a few tiny paper shreds beside the bed when tearing something the 2nd night, and noticed they were never vacuumed up entire rest of stay. Nothing to complain about as rest of room and bathroom absolutely spotless. Rooms on the Borghese garden views can be a bit noisy... sirens, trucks dumping what sounded like recyables (glass shattering sounds) every morning early, etc. But hey, you are in the middle of a city, what do you expect! Just mentioning, in case you feel the need to ask for a different location for perhaps more quiet! It didn't bother us. One other thing: when we arrived, we were keeping our car for one extra day for an Almafi coast daytrip, and the doorman was quite forceful trying to get us to go to the 50euro/night garage at the hotel -- wasn't pleasant. We went very nearby to the Borghese Garden garage for 18euro a night which before we went on the trip the concierge at hotel had emailed me about upon my inquiry. Speaking of emails, Marco was extremely responsive and timely in answering all of emails I sent to the hotel before our trip... as was the concierge desk when he referred us to them for questions. I thought I saw when I checked in, copies of my emails with our reservation. If so, that's a very good customer service move :). All in all, if there was a feeling of being snubbed at this hotel, it was with the doormen --- for instance, of all the times we took cabs during our stay, to and from hotel, I think only once was the door opened for me. We were there on a budget and might have looked it, but to everyone else's credit at the hotel, they were wonderful! I don't know enough of other hotels whether this one if worth paying for or not since we were on points, but the service overall was impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable Marriott, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MacBoyMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights before a cruise & a week later for 2 nights. Rooms were very clean & well appointed & comfortable, and the second stay we were given the a 3rd floor room with a (SWEET) lovely balcony overlooking the street. Great location to walk to the Borghese park, Spanish steps, and great shopping. Could probably walk to the main train station from here too. And for the metro, there's a station stairs underground right across the street. Easy to get a cab here. Good option if you dont want to rent a car, but see a lot of Rome. Clean, upscale hood with lots of eateries. Service ok on average: generally very nice standard front desk. Only 50% of the time the doormen were greeting us warmly & opening the door (perhaps we didn't look money enough?). Were given a complementary bottle of wine in our room the first stay, don't know if that was because of spouse's Marriott status?

Reviews.Title: “Fair hotel, fair location, fair price”
Reviews.Author: SavorSluthTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Grand Flora is a decent property. However, the inside room that faced the courtyard and the limited areas to walk from the hotel didn't make it terribly appealing. Was within cab of train station and most bus stops.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: ErinLeary
Reviews.Content: I was here from May 22 through the 28th. The location was great and the hotel was charming. Each room those in our group had were unique - mine was small with a large bathroom and windows that looked out to the space between the buildings. It was amazingly quiet and comfortable. The bed was very nice and the housekeeping staff was very pleasant and courteous. The best start to my day was the breakfast buffet on the 7th floor. I was able to enjoy the view of the city while sipping an espresso. Since the next stop was the office, it was important to soak in the view and some sunshine first. The lobby staff was very efficient and gracious and I enjoyed the service in the bar as well. All in all, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel! Very nice accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: CarolLeeAtlanta
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for two nights using Marriott Reward points. I am a Platnimum so I also got a free breakfast. Room was very nice, but even thought the front desk assured me it was a room with twin beds when I got there it had been made up a as King. They were able to fix it during the day while we were out. Also, even though there were two guests they only left one robe? Little details mean a lot at these price points and they have some work to do. Staff overall was very good Breakfast was very nice. On the top floor with a nice outside terrace with a great view. Food was also GREAT. Not sure it's worth what they probably charge, but if you can get it included, use it!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price”
Reviews.Author: MichaelNYCNJ
Reviews.Content: We just returned from two weeks in Italy, the final four days were spent in Rome, where we stayed at the Marriot Grand Flora ( which most Taxi drivers only seem to know as the Flora). I'm not sure what the source of some of the gripes I've read from other travellers are about. This Hotel was top notch. The wife and I are from the NYC area, and she especially is very demanding in her accomodations. She was ecstatic with our choice of the Flora. The king size bed in our room (room 115) was the most comfortable of our entire Italy trip. The hotel was classically and classily appointed. The staff were attentive and helpfull. The breakfast buffet was grand. The location just outside the Villa Borghese is among the best in the entire city. All this comes at a price, but that should be no surprise to anyone who has stayed at a fine hotel in any world class city. I've spent more on a room in Boston. I would recomend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: BrianHighley
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Grand Flora in Rome is a beautiful hotel in a great location in Rome. The hotel staff was great! Hotel restaurant was very nice, but so many other fantastic restaurants in the area. I highly recommend this property if you're staying in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “great location, poor service”
Reviews.Author: sanjesh11
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great as this is very close to rialto metro stop. US embassy is close by. The restaurants in this area are super pricy ($7 for coke, $16 for a mug of beer). we had a real bad experience in this hotel. I am gold status with marriott, but still the staff didnt care about that. The room was furnished ok, but clearly not well maintained (stained carpets, marks on room walls). This hotel is also not kid friendly. The breakfast buffet was ok, but not well serviced.. we had to ask 3 times for toast before we got it. Also not many good options for vegetarian folks. Inspite of me complaining to the hotel manager and GM, there was no action taken regarding my room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Irvine92606
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on Via Veneto in a very upscale neighborhood. It took about 20-25 minutes to walk to Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, and Pantheon area. The cab ride to Colosseum was 5 euro. We took the Metro to the Vatican area and the ride costs 1 euro, or you can buy a one-day pass for 4 euro good for subway as well as buses. Front reception is professional and friendly. Our request for early check-in was accommodated. FREE INTERNET FOR 7 DAYS! (we did not get free Internet anywhere else on this trip to Italy). Room is lovely and quiet. The shower does not flood the bathroom, which is rare in Italian hotels. Lovely hotel. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, very quiet, very safe, very expensive”
Reviews.Author: rbuck82
Reviews.Content: My wife, her parents and I just returned from a 10-day trip to Italy. We spent our first three nights in Rome and stayed at the Marriott Grand Flora. It is on Via Veneto in the northern part of the city in a very upscale neighborhood about two blocks from the American embassy and then another couple of blocks from the Hard Rock Cafe. The only reason I mention the proximity to those two places is to point out that this neighborhood seems to cater to well-to-do American travelers. The area was clean, quiet and safe - very upscale. The hotel is just a hop over from the Westin by the embassy where all of the diplomats seemed to be staying. The staff at the hotel spoke good English, although I sensed a bit of an attitude in spite of my efforts to speak Italian. The rooms were clean and spacious by European standards. The porters were attentive and the concierge generally helpful. There were two computers near the lobby with complimentary Internet access and a couple of restaurants. There is a roof terrace where they serve a breakfast buffet. The views across to the Vatican are quite nice, but the breakfast was certainly not worth 30 Euros per person! If I could do it over, I'd skip the breakfast and just go up and ask to spend a few minutes out on the terrace to take in the view and snap some photos. With no offense intended toward the hotel, there are two significant drawbacks to it. First is value. The only reason we chose this hotel was because we could stay on Marriott points and we were trying to keep the cost of our trip down. However, her parents paid the full rate, which was over 300 Euros per night. We stayed at other hotels in Italy that were perfectly clean and spacious and included free breakfast that cost a third of that rate. So I'm not giving them high marks on value. I feel like we could have stayed somewhere else and been just as happy and saved a lot of money. If you're using points, that's one thing. But if you're paying, I'd consider the cost factor. The other main drawback was location. The hotel is not too far from Piazza Barberini, where you can catch the metro. The problem is that the metro in Rome is not nearly as helpful to tourists as it is in other world cities. There are buses, but that may not be your thing. It wasn't for us. You can reach the Spanish Steps within 20 minutes or so by walking, but it is extremely far to walk to the Ancient City Center and darn near ridiculous to try walking to the Vatican. We did a lot more walking than was probably necessary and took a few too many taxis, in my opinion. It would have been easier to stay closer to the city center by saving our wallets and our feet from exhaustion. Don't get me wrong - we are Marriott loyalists and rack up many, many points per year. But the American luxury chains in Europe are so expensive just because they're in Europe. I think they do well because some travelers feel more comfortable with a brand they know and cost isn't a factor. If you're seeing more than Rome, you'll almost be forced to stay at local hotels, and once you do, comparatively speaking, you may feel that you overpaid at the Grand Flora. We definitely had a great stay with them. I just wish my in-laws didn't end up forking out so much money because it wasn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful. Didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: Susannahdm
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Marriott grand flora for a week with a friend before our college study abroad program started. To give some background, I am well traveled and have stayed in 4--5 star hotels world over. My friend is a Marriott Platium member so we stayed on points for 4 nights and then I paid for the 5th. I normally stay in boutique hotels so I was a bit dissapointed when we decided to stay here. However I was very suprised. The building is beautiful and very luxurious with a beautiful entrance. The doormen were wonderful and very helpful. Room We decided intead of getting two double beds to get a King suite and it was just beautiful and HUGE! This was one of the largest hotels room I have ever stayed in, in Italy. Also the bed was so comfortable and the water pressure of the shower was perfect. The room was spotless. We had an incredible view of Via Veneto and the ancient gates of Rome. We are able to take many lovely pictures of the sunset over these gates. . Location I loved the area this hotel is located in, I felt every safe but it is the 5th ave of Rome so it is not inexpensive. If you do not like to walk or spend money on taxis then stay somewhere else but we loved it. We only took taxis at night and walked everywhere during the day. Walking in this area is lovely. It is only a 10 minute walk to the Spanish Steps which is a wonderful shopping area. The beautiful Villa Borghese Gardens are right next door which were wonderful for taking a break from the city. Staff The staff were also great. Even though we are both 22 our parents called ahead to the hotel to tell them we were visiting by ourselves and to watch out for us. That they did. For example, we ran into two friends from school (both male) who were also about start the study abroad program and decided to go back to our hotel room to relax. The front desk asked for their IDs (i assume this is hotel policy-which I think is great) and then about 15 minutes later they called to make sure my friend and I were doing alright. I really appreciated this. The conceierge (I am sorry I don't remember his name...this was at the beginning of June) booked tickets and recomended wonderful resturants for us to go to. He also warned us of areas to stay away from. The front desk greeted us everytime they saw us. The doormen were also kind and even got to know our names and our "schedule of sorts." We never actually ate at the hotel so I cannot comment about the food. Overall we were sad to leave and were treated wonderfully. I would come back here in a heartbeat, next time with my fiancee.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: jdm77345
Reviews.Content: I am a Marriott Rewards Platinum member. We stayed at the Marriott Grand Flora on points. The staff treated us great, as if we were paying full price. We were offered a queen room at first, asked for a king bed, and it was given to us. The room was nice. The staff spoke great English and were very helpful to us on our visit. My wife and I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, grand time”
Reviews.Author: travelfunaddicts
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly situated for sightseeing, shopping, restaurants and the overall character of Rome. Close to the Piazza del Spanga, the Spanish Steps, and of course, located on La Dolce Vita, the Via Veneto, across from the Villa Borghese. Rooms are well decorated and well appointed, the staff is friendly and helpful, transitioning easily from Italian to English. The bar is quiet in the early evening but live music later. Sat for several hours next to the fireplace in the lobby reading and relaxing on our last day here. Wonderful stay, won't hesitate to return. Business meeting space was good and service was very good. Molto bono.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of first room offered but otherwise very lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Islanlady
Reviews.Content: We were very favorably impressed when the car pulled up to the Grand Flora. It has a lovely old world charm, and is on the Via Veneto, just at the foot of the Villa Borghese park entrance. After a long transatlantic flight we were happy to hear the reception clerk say that our room was ready. Unfortunately it was the size of my closet and faced a shaft. I said this won't do and went back downstairs to the clerk. There was a flurry of Italian and no posibles, (I speak some Italian and Spanish) but I said this is not what we paid for through the cruise line. I even called the Princess rep over to look into it. They said perhaps something would come up later and suggested that we go for lunch. We did and miraculously, upon returning were shown to a lovely room facing the Via Veneto. A European friend had once counseled me that most Europeans will not accept the first room offered, and ask to see several. My husband usually stays in the lobby because he knows better. He usually accepts whatever is given him. I was not looking for an upgrade just what we had paid for with Princess. The rest of the stay was wonderful, the bed was very comfy and had nice linens, housekeeping was timely and there was turn down service nightly. The location cannot be beaten and the room was quiet enough, although I don't mind city noises. Breakfast was very nice from their rooftop cafe. The selections were good. You could see all of Rome from the terrace. It would be fabulous for a wedding reception. The service there was also excellent. We had tickets to the Galleria Borghese, and the park was televising the World Cup matches in the park. There were lots of people having fun all over. (Until Italy lost) The American Embassy is just down the Via Veneto and so is the Metro, and the Spanish Steps is a short walk away, as are other museums such as the Galleria Nazionale d'Arte Antica. I would rate the hotel higher if we had not had the unfortunate incident with the tiny dark room that they tried to push on us. We did something different this time and had a private cooking class with an American woman who lives in the shadows of the Coliseum. Her website looks great but I do not recommend her class at all. It was overpriced for what she cooked. We first shopped at the Markets of Testaccio and then headed back to her flat but she was bad tempered and rude, and the food was ordinary. We shared the class with another couple and the instructor made out like a bandit for what she spent on materials that day and what she collected from us. She refused to cook a meat or fish dish. The view of the coliseum from her roof was spectacular though. I will be more careful from now on as to whom I book independent classes with. She has managed to make a name for herself in Rome and through William Sonoma, she edited a cookbook they put out on Roman food, but she wasn't much of a cook and was certainly tight and bad tempered. I love Rome and the Marriott Grand Flora was lovely to come back to, we will definitely come back, I hope next time they give us what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT”
Reviews.Author: jrhmdtraum
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over New Years. What a great hotel Great location (short walk from top of Spanish Steps or escalator to bottom of steps) Great staff Great room service Great rooms Not a large convention hotel although there was a bridge tournament going on. The only slightly negative is that I have had better food in the club lounge at others

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Europe...Marriott is always our first choice”
Reviews.Author: lvrjl
Reviews.Content: We stayed using our Marriott Rewards Points....great value. Not sure we could afford to pay cash. The Rooms were adequate...not large but that sounds like the norm in Europe. Staff was very attentive and helpful. Except on the last night they forgot our wake up call to catch our ride to the airport...very frustrating. During the week my wife needed ice for a muscle pull. There are no ice machines on the floors. However, room service quickly helped out. The concierge was alway very helpful with directions and suggestions. When in Rome a lot of walking is the way to see the sights!! We were not near any of the main attractions (Coloseum, Vatican)...about 45 minute walks. Spanish Steps about 5 minute walk, Trevi Fountain...about 15 minute walk. Villa Borghese is a beautiful park right outside you door. We had cappuccino and a pastry around the corner at the "bar". Very friendly...reminded me of my grandmother. The Veneto area is a very upscale section of Rome...if you're looking for bargains this is not the place. Shopping further away is recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Grand Hotel Flora and Rome - the perfect combination”
Reviews.Author: momofahorselover
Reviews.Content: We are just concluding a week in Rome with our 2 adult daughters. Each morning we would meet for a fantastic buffet breakfast on the 7th floor. The hotel is at the top of Via Vittorio Veneto - just below Borhgese Gardens so you take in a perfect view of Rome from the huge expanse of windows while dining. The staff is warm and very helpful but other than suggestions for dining, your access to Rome needs no assist! The taxi stand is a couple of blocks down the hill, and the A Metro Barbarini stop a couple of blocks further. We walked or rode all over Rome and we always came home to a beautiful and tranquil room overlooking Via Veneto. For those who are light sleepers, we live suburban quiet lives and noise was never an issue - just Roman background music. The restaurant, The Cabiria,and the bar are also of excellent quality and service.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to stay in a business hotel that could be anywhere, stay here.”
Reviews.Author: RonFMiller
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, but I was in Rome and hoping for something that made me feel like I was in Italy. This hotel could have been anywhere. I was also there for Christmas, but you wouldn't have known it from the lack of anything festive. It was also a lousy location for a tourist, being on a large busy street and not close to very many attractions. My room was small with a view of a wall which had windows that had been "concreted up." However, the biggest disappointment was that I am a Marriott platinum but got what could have been the worst room in the hotel. I went back to ask if there was a room with a view of anything other than a wall and was told the hotel was full. (I then went on-line and tried booking three rooms for that night and learned there was availability in various room levels.) The staff recommended that I check back every day to see if a better room became available. Instead I checked out and forgoed the free breakfast (which was in a beautiful space, but not great food) and free Internet to stay at a comparable hotel that was on a quiet street in a great tourist and shopping location with old world Italian elegance. However, if you are there on business, this hotel is up to Marriott standards in terms of cleanliness, safety, and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: JMMD28
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott for 8 nights and we had a great time at this hotel. Our room was ready as soon as we checked in, the room was big for european standards and very well kept and clean. The breakfast in the hotel's top floor was amazing, and the bar in the first floor was a great place to unwind and relax after a day of walking all over Rome. The location of the hotel was very good because even though you are located in the city center the hotel is located in an area that is not crowded by tourists. It is true that there is a Metro Station across the street from the hotel, but once you enter the station you have to walk a good 15 minutes in order to reach the actual metro, so keep that in mind when planing a metro trip from the hotel. There is a Taxi Station half a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: hammerdroogs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here using points for 5 nights and it was a great experience. Unlike other hotels when you stay with points, the staff was very friendly and even gave us a room upgrade. The room was clean and quiet. The breakfast was very good each morning with a great view from the roof. The location is great as it is fairly close to the Spanish Steps metro stop and there a number of bus stops just outside the hotel that can get you pretty much anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Unless Using Points or on Business, Not Worth the Price”
Reviews.Author: stevetanyaTexas
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with points or on business but not worth the price otherwise. Unless you have free breakfast due to status, forget the breakfast on the rooftop. For 30 Euro you can go around the corner to a pastry shop for breakfast with coffee and you will get service. Upstairs you get poor service, average food, nice view, and a big bill. Go up and take pictures from the rooftop and then go elsewhere for breakfast. Rooms were nice. Bed was comfortable. Neighborhood is very high end. Beware of men inviting you on the corner to "buy you a drink"...they are trying to get you back to an expensive strip-bar. There is never a door-man working the door. They are usually on their cell phone and doing something else. They tell you to get your own cab.
