The front desk might be helpful if you get the right person...but there's one woman who refuses to smile. Forget about Concierge reccomendations for a restaurant. If they tell you to go to the one around the corner...Vero Girarrosto Tosca Roma...forget it. See my other review for that restaurant. Way over-priced with mediocre food. Again, if I had points I'd stay again. If I had to pay, I find something else. This hotel is about a 20 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough”
Reviews.Author: accidental_squirrel
Reviews.Content: We booked this property with some concerns. I am a Marriott platinum member and was planning on using points. Although this rated as one of Marriott's nicest hotels (at least as to the number of points required), other trip advisor reviewers had unpleasant experiences and suggested that the hotel simply didn't like granting award stays. We certainly didn't get the "best available" room as referenced in our platinum level. Neither did it comply with my profile which was for a high floor room. It was on a middle level and on the street side of the busy Via Veneto. However, it turned out to be a pleasant stay for us. The windows were double pane and the street noise was much less by 10 or 11 PM. I only used my ear plugs once. The breakfast was nice, the room clean and modern, and the staff were nice. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Four Star rating is about right for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Falcon-One
Reviews.Content: As one reviewer noted, most things about this hotel are rather good--but not outstanding. Most hotels at this price (expensive) in this type of location leave you with strong impressions--good or bad. The Marriott Grand Flora left me with feelings of adequacy. The rooms were very clean and contained what you needed--but were small. The front desk staff was friendly while they were dealing with you, but always seemed like they were in a rush to do something else. It was annoying to have them handle two or three phone calls while simultaneously trying to provide you with some type of customer service. A lot of the reviewers talked about the breakfast buffet. Perhaps we should have tried it, but at around fifty dollars per person that seemed over the top even by Rome and Via Veneto standards. Room service was very fast, but pretty much a crap-shoot as to what you would receive and what you would be charged. The first day we ordered coffee and croissants in the morning and received a nice pot of coffee and a small basket of croissants and assorted pastries and jams. According to the menu this should have cost a total of 19 Euros--they billed us 60 Euros (which the front desk changed to 13 Euros after I inquired about proper price). We ordered exactly the same thing the next day and received coffee and two very small croissants with no butter or jam. The third day I inquired as to what I would receive if we ordered the same thing, but the person who was taking the order did not speak enough English for effective communication so we just had coffee. Internet connection and the Business Center were free, which was nice. However, connectivity was inconsistent. If you are in reasonable shape the hotel is within walking distance to most attractions and a short taxi ride to all attractions if you prefer not to walk. All in all, if the price were right (call directly to reservations to get the best price) I would stay at the Marriott Flora again, but I would shop around first.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Handle
Reviews.Content: We were lucky to book 5 nights using points and paid for 4 more nights. We were very impressed with the staff from the moment of check in until we left. We arrived at 10:00am on Sunday morning and were told that we would be upgraded if we could wait a short while until a room was ready. Since breakfast was not included we were given several 2 for 1 vouchers and proceded to eat while waiting for the room - what a view!! The buffet was standard for most of the hotels we have stayed in in Italy but over priced if you didn't have the voucher. Our room was ready for us by the time we finished breakfast and well worth the wait. King size bed on the 4th floor overlooking Via Veneto, very clean with a marble bathroom. We normally don't eat in hotel restaurants but decided to give the Cabiria a try our first night since it was raining - it was the best Marriott restaurant we have experienced. Rita was most helpful as was the chef in providing items for my wife who has dietary issues. We ate there twice even though there were several good restaurants close by. The hotel recommended a local restaurant around the corner to the right which was excellent and we found found 2 more across the street and down a couple of blocks on Aurora. There is a great coffee and pastery shop across the street and to the left. Also across the street next to Harry's Bar is a walking tunnel to the Spanish Steps (15 min) there is an elevator to the top of the Steps just before step out of the tunnel. Also a great grocery store in the tunnel 7 min with great wine and cheese. Even though most sights are a little bit of a hike from the hotel (except the Villa Bourghese) the Hop on Hop Off Red bus stop is across the street and down 100 ft. They offer a 20 Euro 48 hour pass which is a great way to get around. We also used a lot of taxis - there is a taxi stand next to the hotel. We found our stay at Grand Hotel Flora to be a most enjoyable and experience and felt very secure and well taken care of. Gianni the Primo Barman makes a wicked Gin & Tonic. Highly recommend the Grand Hotel Flora - it lives up to its name!

Reviews.Title: “Loved every second of it”
Reviews.Author: Sheridan2867
Reviews.Content: After my time in Venice (which I hated) I was really looking forward to getting to Rome and was very relieved to get to a Mariott again. From the moment I checked in to the time I checked out, the staff at the Grand Flora were just fantastic. Escpecially Alberto at the front desk--he was always so accomodating and attentive. Even when he had to keep connecting me to all my phone calls! This hotel is on the gorgeous Via Veneto right next to the incredibly beautiful Villa Borghese Gardens. I had a nice stroll through these gardens every morning after breakfast and before the hectic pace of Rome took over my day--it was sublime. The Room: Clean, comfortable and spacious with a HUGE bathroom. Loved it. Not the greatest view in the world but I was hardly in the room--there is so much to do and see (and eat!) in Roma. The breakfast buffet was perfect but what was even more perfect is the view you get of the city while sipping your coffee. Amazing. (I attached some pics) For the buffet, they had your typical European assortment of food; eggs (hardboiled or scrambled) a selection of cheese and meats, tons of breads/pastries, an assortment of juices etc, etc. It was not lacking anything. Also, Donatella at the front desk was always courteous and accomodating---so were the other dining room staff. If you're going to be in Rome for a few days, it's worth it to purchase the Roma Pass (25 euros) which allows you free access to ALL transit plus gets you in free to 2 museums/monuments. All the others, you get a discount on. You can't use it for The Vatican though--that's a seperate fee. The Galleria Borghese museum is about a 5 min walk from the hotel so don't forget to see it--another absolute MUST while in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Dont waste points or dollars here - worst service”
Reviews.Author: Troublemlkr
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nites using points and paid $430 euro for last nite. The visit started off poor, when my cousin (50 yr old) and her children dropped me off here to leave my luggage before visiting the Van Gogh exposition. The front desk insisted that only 1 person could accompany me to my room and must show/leave their ID at the desk. After a 2 hr drive from Napoli, we wanted to leave my bags in the room and use WC. I am a Marriott Silver, a downgrade from my prior Gold status. I insisted that the 4 of us go upstairs together, and they finally relented after my cousin left her id at the desk. This is the rudest treatment i have ever experienced at any hotel in the world. I was dressed in jeans but my cousins, true to being italian were well dressed. While this hotel sez it has free wifi, it is only wireless in the lobby - rooms require a cable. As i travel with an ipad, i had to sit in the lobby alot, and their security guy kept staring at me as if i were a thief. While i appreciated the king (italian matramonisl) bed, it was very uncomfortable and the room was difficult to adjust the temperature. I did appreciate the mini bar. I will say that the concierge was very accommodating and arranged a really nice cooking class at Gaeteano Costa. The final night, the new front desk staff person, was very nice, but it could not have made up for my embarrassment for how i and my family was treated. I am Gold at Starwood and wished i had stayed at the Excelsior 2 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: kukla2669
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Grand Flora was our oasis in Rome. After long days of sightseeing, it was such a pleasure to walk into the lobby of this hotel. The staff was gracious and welcoming and our room was a perfect size and quiet. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was well appointed. I especially enjoyed looking out my window to see the people walking on the Via Veneto. Our group of four enjoyed The Cabiria Bar for nightcaps with the attentive bartender and piano playing. As Marriott members we used our points to stay five nights and we enjoyed every one.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, superb service, beautiful views and nice location”
Reviews.Author: Salty74
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Rome with my spouse for a five night stay in Sept. of 2010 and this was the first stop on a two week tour of Europe. When researching a hotel to stay at in Rome using points I must have missed the "booking w/ points window" for the Marriott Grand Flora dispite being over nine months early. Despite this, Marriott worked with me, contacted the hotel and the hotel gave us approval to use points. Additionally the automatically upgraded us with an executive suite with a great view of Via Veneto. Being a Marriott Gold Member also entitled us to breakfast as part of our room package. The Hotel: We had excellent service and there were no problems checking in. We arrived way before check in time but within an hour they had our room ready to go giving us some time to grab breakfast at a nearby cafe. The lobby was clean and cozy and did come with free wireless internet. There was also a bar and restaurant off of the lobby area. We had some drinks at the bar but did not utilize the restaurant. The concierge was excellent and made some excellent dining recommendations during our stay along with some good sightseeing tips. They also offered various tours that we did not utilize. Quick note, the hotel does not sell the Roma Pass however there is a Tabac around the corner that sells them. The Room: We utilized points for our stay as mentioned and were upgraded to an executive suite. We stayed on the fifth floor in the corner room. One side of our room had a very nice view facing south down the Via Veneto and the other window had a nice view of the western Rome skyline and the Villa Borghese. The room consisted of a small breezeway just inside the main door with a large dresser, closet and bathroom access just inside the door. Then you entered the main room area that featured a king size bed, small tv, a desk and small chair and table area. I've noticed a lot of complaints that the rooms were small at this hotel - I guess if you're thinking it's going to be an "American style" suite you will be dissappointed but for two people this was more than enough space and was very comfortable and romantic. I prefer a bed with stronger support which this bed had in my opinion. The bathroom had plenty of room to do what you needed and was very clean and nice. Being on the corner room I'm guessing the actual tub/shower stall had to be fit into a somewhat tight space but overall it was fine. Lastly, I have read some complaints that the street noise kept people up at night. We had no issue with this but we are hard sleepers. We noticed some honking here and there but nothing major. We honestly didn't notice a whole lot when we closed the curtains all the way. Make sure to do the turndown service if for nothing else then the snacks they leave on your bed...they are delicous! Our only compaint is about the air conditioning. It was really hot and humid when we were there and you have to leave a key in a wall sensor to keep the AC going. The first day we left the key in w/ the air on...when we came back to the room looking forward to a relaxing (and chilling) break from the heat...the housekeeping service had taken the extra key thereby turning off he AC. However, once turned back on the room cooled off quickly. The Location: I read a great tip about arriving from the airport and taking the metro and will repeat it here. There are two metro stops within a 5-10 minute walk from the Grand Flora...the Barberini stop and the Spagna stop. Use the Spagna stop if you are arriving from the airport with bags. You can walk underground on a smooth service by following the directions from the Spagna stop to the Via Veneto. You will literally be let out of the underground passage way directly in front of the hotel. Yes, you lose the views of the city while you are underground but you can make that up later. If you get off at Barberini you will have a long, winding walk up hill with all your luggage. A taxi from the central station to the hotel will run you about 8-10 Euro in traffic. Being on the fabulous Via Veneto you are surrounded by a ton of excellent restaurants, cafes and even a few night clubs. Yes, Harry's Bar is across the street - go in - have a drink and a snack - live the good life and be on your way. Keep in mind the area around this hotel is very, very expensive. The traditional Italian dinner for two (app, 1st course, 2nd course, bottle of "reserve" wine and dessert) will run you around 150 Euro. Just a short walk down the Via Veneto you can find excellent restaurants for half the price and just as good. There are a number of bus lines that stop just out front of the hotel so you have easy access to all the sights. Additoinally, one of the "hop on - hop off" bus stops just a few blocks south of the hotel and it appeared that all the rest of the hop on - hop off busses stopped at the Piazza Barberini south of the hotel within a 5-10 minute walk. We could not find a nearby market to buy light snacks, drinks, wine for the room so you will either have to use the minibar or stop outside the Via Veneto area to get a few things. The only reason I bring this up is that the Villa Borghese (huge park) is literally right across the street and is an excellent spot for picknicking and people watching. The Rooftop Terrace: Simply beautiful. The rooftop terrace is the area where breakfast is served every morning and it has an amazing view of Rome and particularly of the dome at St. Peters Basillica. If you are a Marriott Rewards member and get free breakfast take advantage of this opportunity. If not, breakfast is really expensive, I would recommend having one breakfast just for the view. I've noticed a lot of people complaining about the breakfast and that it was not substancial enough...those people are crazy. If you are expecting the traditional american breakfast and do not like to try new things you will be dissappointed. Or you can enjoy some excellent coffee, amazing pastries and fresh bread, juices, teas, mamosas, Coke (in glass bottles), various types of sausages, bacon (it won't be real crisp), fresh italian meats and cheeses and assorted types of eggs (scrambled was kind of soggy but the "omellette" tasted more like regular scrambled eggs). I am not picky so I gave everything a try over the course of our stay and really enjoyed it. My wife is more picky but "managed" to get buy on the fresh pastries, croissants and nutella. There was one interesting selection on the buffett and it was labeled "potatoes" and "second course" - I won't ruin the suprise but it's pretty funny - if you go - make sure to open this heating dish up and peek inside. The Sights: There are a number of great sights within easy walking distance to the hotel and the rest of Rome is accessible via the metro or bus. Spend some time getting to know the public transport system - it only takes a few minutes - and you will pat yourself on the back for it. We are walkers...we walked a ton and utilized the metro and the hop on/off bus tour quite a bit. Within easy walking distance are the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain (both maybe a 10 minute walk). As mentioned, the Villa Borghese (think of it as Rome's Central Park) is literally across the street and features a fantastic art museum (you have to reserve a timeslot at the Museo Borghese and space is limited - book it before you arrive or at least two days prior to when you want to see it). You can walk to the central train station or take the metro a couple of stops. To walk to the central train station give yourself 15-20 minutes. 10 more minutes past (south) of the train station and you'll be starring the Colesseum in the face along with the Roman Forum, Palatine Hill and the ancient center of Rome. The Vatican is difficult to get to anywhere in Rome - you can take the Metro a few stops and walk a bit - we found it easier to just take a taxi b/c we were on a tight timeline - it cost us 14 Euro. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our time in Rome and the Marriott Grand Flora was a big part of our enjoyment. As mentioned, we stayed using Marriott points. Rooms at this hotel can run into the $300's per night...If you are a $300 a night person you may at least want to take a look at a couple of the nearby hotels just to compare. There were a lot of top end hotels in the area. I'm not the type of traveller that would normally pay this much money for any hotel. If I was travelling for business I would be a little put off that I had to pay for wi-fi in the room but at the same time...I would be in Rome...I would probably go down to the lobby bar or just outside on the cafe and do some work versus sitting in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel on Exquisite Via Venuto”
Reviews.Author: Stephen11000
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Gran Flora is a wonderful hotel. The rooms, staff and food are excellent. Breakfast is served on the top floor of the hotel. You may eat outside with outstanding views of the city or inside. The breakfast is the most generous in regard to selection and fine quality. Each day for no charge you may have a picnic lunch to take if you wish. The Gran Flora located on Via Venuto is surrounded by excellent restaurants-Harry' Bar and Grille and many others. You can easily walk to the Spanish Steps and if you are in good shape Trevi Fountain. Other sites are a short taxi ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PackLitely
Reviews.Content: So its obvious that this hotel was not originally a Marriott when you first walk into your hotel room, but with that said - the room was spacious, the bed was comfy and the bathrooms had everything we needed - no complaints there. The hotel is in a great location and easy to walk to many tourist attractions and the metro. Also, lots of good restaurants nearby. Our only complaint would be with the concierge service - both days we headed out to tour Rome, we asked the concierge to make us dinner reservations - and when we would get back from touring for the day we would find that the reservations had not been made, and were told the concierge would call our room - and never did. We had to call several times for help with reservations - that were eventually made - but still i expect more from Marriott. Other than that, the hotel was nice, not a typical Marriott, but a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: hcrtex
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 8:30 AM and they gave us a beautiful room on the top floor with two balconies and a view of the Roman Wall. We also were using points and were treated great. The room was large with a king bed. They recommended some great places to eat that we visited and the staff always went the extra mile. We had breakfast included, but if you have to pay it is about 30 E a person and rather high. We were with friends and I got them to give them 50% off the meal. Pays to ask. Will stay here again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: AroundGlobe
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is rather good. But the key word in this phrase is "rather". After two stays I can remember nothing that could make me think of Marriott Roma when planning next stay in Rome. Even their fabulous roof terrace with a breath-taking view over the whole centre of Rome left no memories. Maybe because of 2-stars breakfasts with 2-stars service. And maybe that's the reason why this Marriott is the only 4-star hotel among all the other 5-starsMarriott Grand hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Marriott service standards”
Reviews.Author: Cowabunga8
Reviews.Content: The hotel is attractive and conveniently located, but nearby restaurants are pricey. We were fortunate to stay for free using Marriott points. Perhaps that is why they gave us a very small room. The bathroom was small too. Linens were not luxurious. They do not have king size beds and the 2 beds kept sliding apart. They did let us check email free on their computers. The doormen and the concierge were barely helpful. Disappointing service. If we had to pay, we'd check out the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Be away- My own advice”
Reviews.Author: Saqar
Reviews.Content: Marriott Grand Flora from my experience (July 15, 2010) with other Marriott and other 4 stars hotels was indeed very disappointed. My booking was for seven nights, 300 Euros per night. I ended my stay at the first day, switching to Grand hotel next to Marriott. I complained as I was expect great hotel rather than very aged hotel in which I’ve been given very small room with horrible small old fashion bathroom. There answer to my complain, “as an elite member” was we will upgrade you (tomorrow) to a better room. At that point I asked to see what kind of room they will upgrade me to. They show me large room high floor but with the same bad smell furniture and same bathroom design which is unacceptable for me on a base that I should get at least as I paid. There response was ‘if you want to complain do that on our site’. Sorry for the long story but I’m actually hate Marriott altogether.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, would go back.”
Reviews.Author: Travel4Lving
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed our stay, as we stayed three nights in two rooms. (Kids in one, adults in others). The rooms are small by American standards, so there is no way to put four in a room. You'll need to splurge a bit or use points. I enjoyed the hotel, but I think the Via Veneto is past its heyday. As we strolled through Rome, I was wishing we would have stayed a in a little more "authentic" neighborhood, and the Via Veneto is crammed with hotel names you can see anywhere. We walked to the Spanish Steps and Trevi fountain without issue, but only took the subway to the Coliseum. We had a taxi to the Vatican. The breakfast on the rooftop is a bit oversold. We did it one morning, and found the views to be great, but the food was about what you would find in the average US concierge floor, and the prices were pretty steep. Better values can be had all over Rome, and we found them close to the hotel with better food. Service was up to Marriott standards, as was the housekeeping. I know there are those to list how to "walk" from teh train station, but don't consider it if you are traveling with kids or carrying luggage....it is a haul. I think 10 Euros got four of us to the hotel in 6-7 minutes, and it was money well spent! Not a bad hotel at all, and would go back if I were staying with points!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a beautiful location!”
Reviews.Author: Momsterof4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here using reward points. We had two rooms and one was upgraded to a suite. Roomy, clean, comfortable--very nice. So easy to get here from the metro. When arriving from airport, simply take the Leonardo Express to Roma Station. You will then need to walk from "train station" area to "metro" area. Take the A line to Spagna station and follow signs to Villa Borghese, which will lead you to "Via Vittorio Veneto" tunnel and will dump you directly across the street from the hotel. This is all underground in tunnels--safe and lined with window shopping displays. I recommend this with your luggage as the streets of Rome are crowded and cobblestone, so this direct, underground route is the best when you are tired and dragging your luggage around. For the rest of your trip, walk above ground and enjoy the neighborhood!! Barberini metro is a little closer and I preferred that to the crowd of the Spanish Steps. Either will work fine! (Just use Spagna with your luggage.) The front desk staff of the hotel varied from being very helpful and welcoming, to downright rude. The doormen were all good and our young lady for housekeeping was a sweetheart!! Everyone spoke English (or enough anyway) so communication was not a problem for those of us who do not speak Italian. Avoid breakfast there unless it is free. We arrived in Rome early and our rooms were not yet ready for check-in, but we were able to stowe our luggage so we could sight see. The front desk recommended we eat breakfast on their beautiful rooftop restaurant, which we did. Stale pastries and old coffee--25 euro per person!!! (Welcome to Rome!!) We did not eat there again, although we did have some breakfast vouchers. (the roof top restaurant had beautiful views, though! It closed during the short time we were there for renovations--I don't know when it will open again) There is complimentary coffee/tea in a small room off of the lobby each morning. There are good and reasonably priced restaurants in the area as well as ridiculously expensive ones. The front desk staff did give good recommendations for reasonably priced ones. There is also a small grocery store in the metro tunnel across the street for bottled waters, etc. We found Rome to be much smaller than it looked on the map and delightfully walkable! We did use the metro, but it is very crowded. I think it took about 45 minutes to leisurely walk from the colosseum back to the hotel. We enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: NandN2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Grand Flora for four days and absolutely fell in love with this hotel! It is perfectly located on Via Veneto, one of the most famous streets in Rome, in walking distance to Villa Borghese, Spanish Steps, many restaurants, and short cab ride to Vatican and Colosseum. The staff was wonderful and very helpful. As our trip was dedicated to a special occasion, the hotel had something waiting for us in the room every day - a box of chocolate, picnic lunch box, a bottle of Champagne... We were impressed with our rooms as they were very spacious with old European touches of luxury. Every day was started by having an amazing breakfast on the rooftop terrace overlooking the whole city! We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with a rooftop breakfast to die for”
Reviews.Author: edmondite
Reviews.Content: The Grand Flora was excellent. We loved being close to the Villa Borghese, Spanish Steps, Hard Rock Cafe, Capuchin Crypt, and a little cafe named Turi & Tano. The room was luxurious with wonderful linens and all the special touches of a luxury hotel. Never heard any noise except maybe an occasional motorcycle at night. Surrounded by nice restaurants and other hotels. Loved having a full breakfast every morning on their rooftop patio overlooking the Villa Borghese! Loved the little nut-shaped nutella cookies on our pillow every night! ,

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay at Marriott”
Reviews.Author: AdeleSM
Reviews.Content: We used points for 2 rooms at the Marriott Grand Flora for 4 nights in June. Check-in was easy and our rooms were very clean and comfortable with all marble bathrooms. Breakfast on the roof terrace overlooking the city was exceptionally beautiful, although upon arriving each morning it was difficult to find a clean table to sit down to. We found the location to be very good as we walked to sites with the exception of the Vatican which was a 10 euro cab ride. We should have allowed more time in Rome, although no matter how long of a stay there would still be more to see.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location, staff kinda painful!”
Reviews.Author: Kriscruise
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights - on points (I am a Platinum member). The hotel is really beautiful and in a great location. So at the check in desk - they did not seem to have my reservation correct - and there was a lot of going back and forth in spite of the fact that I had contact the manager of the hotel prior to our travel, had print outs of our reservation etc. Glad I did because their internal reservations had created quite a mix up. The gentleman at the reception desk was probably the most unhelpful person I have ever met at a Marriott - and its sad because this is the first experience that a person usually has with the hotel - he probably should work in the back-end where he does not have to interact with anyone! The staff otherwise were ok, the guys at the door were great and very helpful. The lobby is so-so, the rooms and very nice and we got upgraded . Overall I think its a little too much for 40,000 points so might think several times before staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel showing its age; doesn’t live up to 5-star level”
Reviews.Author: Figaro522
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Marriott Grand Flora in May 2010 for 3 nights. The best thing we found about this hotel was the location; it is easily accessible to the Borghese Gardens, the Metro (Spagna stop), and not a far walk from the center of Rome. The lobby was pretty, with a lot of marble details and a lovely skylight. We checked in around 7 pm and were given room #108. After being in the room for about 30 seconds, the noise level from the Via Veneto below was pretty deafening, even though the windows were closed (we felt like we were on the street!!). When we investigated this further, we found that the extremely old windows did not have any type of seal around the edges so the noise was not filtered or blocked from being heard. The room was pretty small with an abnormally huge closet that was impractical and odd. The bathroom was fairly newly renovated and was fine. We called the front desk to inquire about changing rooms to one on a higher floor and were told that they were completely booked for that night and to call back the next day to see if there was anything they could do about the remainder of our trip. This answer frustrated us because we did not know if we were going to be stuck in this loud, weird room for the entirety of our trip, effectively ruining our night. We didn’t understand why he could not just look in the computer to see if there was another room that we could move into for the next two nights—his attitude seemed like he couldn’t be bothered and wanted someone else to do the dirty work. Anyway, the next morning, we called (and got a different person who answered the phone) and they were able to switch our room, for which we were very grateful. Our new room was on the 4th floor and was significantly quieter and had a normal-sized closet. Between my husband and I, we have stayed at around 20 Marriott hotels (most of them in the US but a few in Europe too), and this hotel did not meet the fine standards to which we are typically accustomed at a Marriott hotel and was certainly not a 5-star quality.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LA_Travelers_1
Reviews.Content: After having stayed at a sub-par hotel for 5 days (hotel delle nazione) we were ready for a nice hotel and the Marriott did not disappoint. They were wonderful and gave us a very nice upgrade overlooking the gardens. Because they are an international chain - the rooms are nice-sized (much bigger than the European standard) They really get it when it comes to customer service - we had an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, BAD service, not worth the $”
Reviews.Author: Frankie2213
Reviews.Content: I visited the Marriott Grand Flora on Christmas Eve with my wife and opted for the 'Savour of Christmas' package, which was supposed to include a room w/ queen bed, a special Christmas Eve dinner for two, and breakfast for two. When we arrived, the staff had no knowledge of the package we and/or what it included, even though we booked it directly through Marriott.com. After finally finding a similar package, they told us the price would be an additional 40euro (on top of the already expensive 350euro ONE night stay) because the package was designed for one person (even though the room was booked for 2 people and the package specifically said dinner for two and breakfast for two). After showing the front desk multiple confirmation forms I had printed detailing the package, I finally gave in and paid the extra 40euro (against my best judgment). The room we were given was nice and spacious and the bathroom was very clean and very big. The Christmas Eve dinner was good and they even allowed us to substitute one course of the meal for something different, as I am not personally fond of an all-seafood menu. Breakfast the next morning was also very good, with a wide variety of high-quality choices. Everything was going well until it came time to check out and they tried to bill us for an extra meal for the Christmas Eve dinner, again saying that we had only paid for one meal even AFTER we had paid the extra 40eruo at the beginning. Basically, they tried every means they could to nickle-and-dime us and ended up realizing they made a mistake after quite a discussion. Would never stay here again, despite the reasonable accommidations and good food, the disappointment of being hasseled with extra charges and an inept staff was too much. For the price you pay, you SHOULD expect more.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Plush Room In A Ritzy Location In Rome”
Reviews.Author: rrlovebirds
Reviews.Content: We arrived by train from Florence for a 5 night stay at the Grand Flora. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful by making dinner reservations at a great restaurant just around the corner. We were pleasantly surprised by the elegance of the room, the lovely marbled bathroom and super comfy queen bed. The bath was supplied with upscale toiletries, hair dryer, towel warmer and a great shower head with plenty of hot water. The room was smaller by US standards but was not a problem for the two of us. Free WIFI and a fully stocked mini-bar was available for purchase. Hotel is located on Via Veneto next to the Borghese Gardens. Recommend you take a leisurely walk through the Gardens. When in Rome again, we will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sundance1
Reviews.Content: We booked through Costco travel. The Grand Flora Marriott was an elegant hotel. Beautiful marble, quiet, wonderful breakfast, served on the roof overlooking the rooftops of ROme. Absolutely beautiful view. Clean spacious rooms. Great service. Restaurants and shops within steps of the hotel. Lots of cafes along with upscale restaurants. Close to the Spanish Steps. Highly recommended. Next to Borghese Park and Via Veneto. Took a day trip to Pompeii, Vatican picked up in front of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel on the best street in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Kris69Mumbai
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights with points and were pleasantly surprised by the location. Being very close to the railway station (and after a 5 hour train ride from Venice) it was nice to be in a bright clean plush hotel. Perhaps it was the fact that we were staying with points, that they gave us a really small room (even by European standards) which was the only disappointment. Lovely restaurants and a few cafes and bars along the Via Veneto really made the trip memorable. Would recommend a stay here, but pls ask for larger rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Gotta love Marriott Points and Hotels”
Reviews.Author: BPInto24
Reviews.Content: Knowing that we were planning our trip to Italy for 2010 I tried very hard to remain a gold member, and very glad i did. Our stay at the Grand Flora was well worth the 80k points for 2 nights considering it was 25k to stay at other sites in Rome. It was great that we were updated to a Junior Suite, were treated to a bottle of wine to celebrate our anniversary and the gratis breakfast was a big plus. We walked everywhere from the location. Yolanda (hope that is right) at the front desk spent almost 15 minutes just helping out with questions and advice on Rome before we checked in... Friday night we sat at the bar and even had a dance to the piano players music. It would hard to complain about anything during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lkinfl
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance of everything! Great restaurants in the hotel and across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for a week in Rome”
Reviews.Author: somuchtosee-yorkpa
Reviews.Content: My Friends and I stayed at the Grand Flora for six nights in the middle of March. The staff was extremely polite and helpful. One of my friend's luggage was lost and the hotel staff was persistent in trying to have it located and delivered. The restaurant and bar had impeccable service. This hotel was in a great location and we could not have been happier with our choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not A Top Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ricci8
Reviews.Content: Disappointing. Room cleaned very late in day. Music from bar can be heard at night. Breakfast buffet is supposed to end at 10:30 a.m. but they do not replenish the buffet after 10 even when there is no bread left and start taking down tables at 10:15 while people are trying to eat. This is not how a first rate hotel treats guests!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulousl Hotel and Location, Location, Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Yulama
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this hotel in mid-September, 2009. This was our first trip to Italy. We found the service to be great, with only one slightly snooty attitude which was erased by the many other beautiful attitudes. We had a 4th floor room over looking Via Veneto. The windows opened for fresh air and to take in the ambiance of Rome. We loved walking all over Rome every day from this convenient location, the best part was the romantic walk up Via Veneto at night to the luxury of the Grand Flora. Our final morning, we ate breakfast on the roof top. We ordered from the menu rather than the $30 Euro buffet. We both had lovely omelets. Mine came without the cheese with the spinach & mushrooms. The error was immediately corrected with the best every spinach/mushroom/cheese omelet I have ever eaten. We then walked out side and took pictures and enjoyed our last look at the Roman skyline. We will stay at the Grand Flora when we return to Rome!!!.

Reviews.Title: “Our European Vacation”
Reviews.Author: mulvab
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, with wonderful views and food. Bathroom and room with large balcony were spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “would go back”
Reviews.Author: dobieloverHullUk
Reviews.Content: went to rome with my husband for 5 nights. the hotel was lovely even though it was expensive. there wasnt any tea and coffee making facilities which i found unusual. the girl at reception was very helpful and gave us a map and circled the best shopping area lol. would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AlabamaTraveler0
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Flora from 26 December 2009 to 31 December 2009. Getting there: The least expensive way to reach the hotel from Fiumicino Airport, is to catch the Leonardo Express at the airport. The tickets can be purchased for 11 Euros each at the self service machines in the train station (the machines accept US Credit Cards and have the option for English instructions). Then wait on the platform for the next train to come in. If you rush the doors when the train comes in, there is a decent chance you will get a seat for the 30 minute trip. Exit the train at the Termini Station and follow the "M" signs to the Metro Station. You will need to do a good bit of walking in the Termini Station, as the Leonardo Express platform is a long way from the Metro platforms (there are many moving sidewalks that will make the trip a little easier). Buy tickets for the Metro (a one day unlimited transport pass is only 4 Euro) and get on Line A- headed for Battistini. If you do not have Euro coins or small Euro notes (5 or 10 Euro notes) go to a ticket window and have the staff issue a ticket. Get off at the Spagna Station (the Barberini station is closer to the hotel, but if you are carrying luggage be advised you will need to carry the bags up a large hill and will need to do most of your walking outdoors). At the Spagna Station, use the exits towards Villa Borghese. After you follow the signs toward Villa Borghese, eventually you will see one that says Via Veneto. Follow those signs to the Via Veneto exit. Be advised that at a leisurely walk it will take you 15 minutes to get from the Metro platform to the hotel entrance. Also, as you head towards the hotel you will use a number of moving sidewalks, escalators, and walk through a number of tunnels. Do not be alarmed, as they are well lit and have security cameras (and maybe a few buskers). Eventually you will exit these tunnels by taking an escalator up to Via Veneto. This exit is right in front of Harry's Bar, and accross the street from the Grand Flora. Check In: Check in is normally 3 PM. We arrived at the hotel about 10:45 AM on a Saturday after a Trans-Atlantic flight. The check in staff was very gracious, and already had a key ready for us to check in. This was much appreciated as we wanted to take a shower and have a nap. Room: We used Marriott Rewards points to pay for the room, but despite that we were assigned a great room- #607 (the lobby is on the ground floor- floor 0 in Europe and floor 1 in the United States). Our first query when we got to the room was how to operate the lights. You have to insert your room key into a slot just inside the room door to activate the lights. Once we figured out how to turn on the lights, we were pleasantly surprised by the room. To the right of the entrance was a decent size bathroom with a deep single tub, toilet, and bidet. The bath had a hand shower, wall mounted shower, and plenty of hot water. The deep bath was very relaxing after a long day. The bathroom also had good amenities- shampoo, soap, body wash, conditioner, mouth wash, cotton swabs, cotton balls, nail files, hair dryer, and shower caps. Opposite the bathroom was a large walk in closet, with plenty of room for hanging items. Also there were drawers for non-hanging iterms and shelves for suitcases. There was an electronic safe. The bedroom portion had a firm king size bed, a writing desk (with paper) on one side of the bed, and a night table on the other side of the bed. There were switches on the side of the bed to operate all the lights and the roller shutter. There was a television that had about 20 channels, about 6 or 7 in Italian, and a few in French and German. There were two English language stations- BBC World News and Bloomberg News. There was also an honor bar in the room and a few snack items that were quite expensive. The mini bar did have some room so that you could put a few bottles of soda or water in it to keep them cool. Possibly the best feature of the room was the balcony. The balcony overlooked Via Veneto, and you could see St. Peter's dome. To the immediate right you could see the entrance to the park surrounding the Villa Borghese. The door to the Balcony was very well sealed, so you heard very little outside noise. Plus the balcony door/window had a roller shutter that blocked out all the light. This helped us get right to sleep for our afternoon nap. Service: The service at the hotel was superb. The desk staff spoke English very well. They also spoke some French. The concierge was very helpful and made dinner reservations for us one night, and arranged for a limo to take us to the airport for an early morning departure. There was a daily maid service (usually in the late morning), and a turn down service about 7 PM (the chocolates they left were artisan made and a welcome treat). Location: The hotel is located near a number of other hotels that cater to foreign tourists (the US Embassy and Hard Rock Cafe are only a half mile down Via Veneto from the hotel). While a short walk is required to get to the Metro station, most of it is through tunnels, so the weather is not really an issue. Also, in the tunnel to the Spagna Metro Station, there is a supermarket that has anything you would need such as sodas, wine, chocolate, grooming products, etc. (just look for the sliding glass doors with shopping trolleys outside). In addition the opposite exit of the Spagna Station is the Spanish Steps. So to get to the Spanish Steps you hardly have to go outside (just through the tunnels). For those so inclined, the first McDonald's in Italy is near the Spanish Steps. Food: On the top floor of the hotel is a lounge that serves breakfast. We ate there each morning. We were not charged for the breakfast because of our Marriott Rewards status. They served scambled eggs, waffles, cereals, breads, jam, fruit, bacon, sausage, cheeses, smoked salmon, olives, and many other choices- all in a buffet setting. They had coffee, juices, Fanta, Coke, Coke Light, and Champagne available at no extra charge to drink. We never ate at the hotel restaurant for lunch or dinner, but the prices seemed in line with other places nearby. The concierge will make reservations for you if you ask at places nearby (he made reservations for us at a place around the corner that was a good value). One day we did go to the aforementioned supermarket and got some fresh bread and meats for a picnic lunch on the Spanish Steps. Business: The lobby had free wifi and there were two public computers in the business center. All you need to do to use them is ask the from desk for a 30 minute password. The service is fast and was running each time we used it. If you needed more than 30 minutes they were happy to give you a password for a longer period. Also each room has wired internet and they would loan you a cord so that you could use your laptop in your room. Unfortunately my computer was acting up so I did not use the in room internet, but had no problem with the wifi in the lobby. Each room has a direct dial phone. I made one local call for about 5 minutes and it cost me 5 cents (Euro). Recreation: The hotel has a fitness room and and indoor pool, but we did not use them. We were already walking so much around the city. We would recommend this hotel for the business or leisure traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott's mistakes are my fault... and I should probably be insulted for it, too.”
Reviews.Author: mpc3f
Reviews.Content: Basic gist of my experience: I booked two rooms for 4 people. Room #1 had one bed for (me and my wife). Room #2 had 2 beds (for my brother and sister). Marriott reservations accidentally made the reservation for room #2 for only 1 person (even though it was a room with 2 beds). Well, an extra person costs extra money - so upon arriving in Rome, I was informed that if I wanted to put 2 people in that room, it'd cost me extra. I politely requested that Marriott honor the price they quoted me, since the error was clearly theirs (why would I specifically reserve a room with 2 beds for only 1 person!?). I asked to speak with a manager and the desk agent (Marco Calderone) said that HE was a manager at ANOTHER Marriott, so I could speak with him. Well, Mr. Calderone -- AS A MANAGER, you should be in a position to make the situation right. If you can't, you should ALLOW me to speak with a someone who can! As all this was going on, another desk agent (older guy) leaned over to Mr. Calderone and spoke Italian to him. Unfortunately for him, I speak Italian and understood him when he said, "wow, this guy wants you to fall for his lies, eh?" I finished the rest of the argument in Italian and made sure the 2nd guy heard me and knew I understood him. Bottom line - Marriott Corporate made the situation right, after the fact, but the Grand Flora is dead to me so long as Marco Calderone and his old buddy are employed there. Otherwise, this is a beautiful hotel in a good location and, like I said, would consider staying there again if these unprofessional people are no longer there.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: pinky45
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed in two rooms at the Flora for four nights in December 2009. We thought the location was ideal. It is across the street from the Rome wall and the Borghese park, which is lovely. It is a quiet and relaxing place to stay. We enjoyed the walk to the center of Rome -- it is at least a 15 minute walk to just about all attractions and a 10-15 minute walk the Spagna and Barberini metro stations. It is also easy to get a taxi right outside, so if you don't want to walk, it is not a problem. The room design is a bit tired, but the excellent service and free internet access compensate. The staff were the best we experienced in Italy (and we thought the staff was very good everywhere we stayed). Special thanks to Massimo at the concierge desk and Sonia at reception. If you use Marriott points, you will definitely not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Staff made the stay perfect”
Reviews.Author: MD88GSP
Reviews.Content: A weekend trip to Rome from the U.S. with my wife. Arrived at the Grand Flora, Told the staff we came just for the weekend and they were a bit surprised. was allowed to shower in a small quest room, but not check in to that room. Upon returning to the lobby, we were given the Presidential Suite at no charge. GM gave us a bottle of wine, we were set up for private tours of the Vatican Museum and treated A+ for the 2 days. We elected to schedule a car from the hotel to FCO, instead of the lower priced cab. The mercedes driver gave us the most informative tour of Rome enroute to FCO. Stay here if you can afford it or have points.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travelsr
Reviews.Content: This Marriott was wonderful. Everything from the location, the hotel staff, the free internet, the cleanliness, and the roof top breakfest. The hotel is within walking distance for everything especially the spanish step and the trevi fountain. As a Gold member I would recommend this hotel. The only recomendation would be to upgrade the TV's and add CNN as one of their channel selections.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience at the Marriott Grand Hotel Flora”
Reviews.Author: Eyal70
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Grand Hotel Flora for a company business meeting. We were a group of 12 people and we also used the hotels meeting facilities. The room was well equipped and comfortable, including free internet, which was very important to me. The meeting room was well prepared including the proper seating arrangement, and the relevant audio visual equipment. Besides the business activities, the hotel is very well located at the top of Via Veneto, and has a rooftop terrance on the seventh floor with an amazing view of the entire city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: PBO
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Rome Flora for 3 nights in September. The hotel is in a wonderful location on the Via Veneto. While not super luxurious, the room was cozy, comfortable and very clean. The service was top notch. Loved sitting on the roof for breakfast....the views were absolutely breathtaking. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gbsd
Reviews.Content: As Marriott Platinum members we stayed here on points to end a month long Italian vacation. This was by far the nicest accommodations we had in Italy, and among the nicest Marriotts we've stayed in anywhere. As platinum members we received a delicious bottle of red wine and fresh fruit upon our arrival. We then walked all over Rome and found the location to be more than adequate to see most of the city on foot. Our room faced the busy main street but with window closed noise was not a problem. It was slightly on the small size but the bed was the large and very comfortable.The staff was very attentive, with free internet access off the lobby. The concierge recommended a restaurant 3 blocks away when asked for "good pasta and pizza" and his suggestion, Pizzeria San Marco was outstanding. Our stay included breakfast each morning on the roof and as far as Italian breakfasts go, this was by far the most delectable one we found anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Miami1982
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Grand Flora in Rome is a wonderful hotel. The breakfast buffet on the 7th floor is a must and the view spectacular. Location is fantstic and the staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Nice area”
Reviews.Author: luckums
Reviews.Content: Our stay was one night on September 27 and three nights Oct 2-4 using Marriott points. We have no complaints although we probably would not have paid the going rate if we did not have points. Our one night only stay was in a slightly better room with a very comfortable bed and luxury linens. The three night stay at the end of our trip to Italy, had a harder bed and standard hotel bedding, so I think there are difference in the rooms withinin the same category. The breakfast on the terrace every day was great - eveything you could want - and the view was beautiful! The front desk staff was helpful. They were very professional if not overly friendly. The hotel is very near the Borghese gardens which we visited twice. We walked to the Trevi fountain every day while at the hotel and to the Spanish steps. We also walked from the Pantheon, the Vatican and the Forum - although those walks were longer than many would consider walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it, even on points”
Reviews.Author: esbelli
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night on 40,000 points. Marriott is not usually my preferred chain, but I had some points to burn and Rome is expensive. This hotel didn't meet my expectations, which were built up by the high room rates and nice pictures. We got a pretty shabby room, even though I am a Gold member of their program. The room was a TINY room on the first floor next to the garbage dump, which we discovered early the next morning as the trucks made lots of noise to haul the trash away. Thankfully we didn't spend much time in the room. Free WiFi in the lobby was nice, and the breakfast was okay because it was free. The front-desk staff was pretty friendly and knowledgeable, but the concierge was a miss with his restaurant recommendation. He forgot to write the name down and had only vaguely marked it on the map. Summary: If this were a $200/night hotel, I'd be pretty satisfied, but I feel ripped off even though I only spent points. Remind me to avoid Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but probably won't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: beenthereonce
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Flora with Marriott points, so it was great value for us. We were traveling with 2 teenagers and thus needed 2 rooms. We booked the rooms 10 months prior to our arrival and requested the 2 rooms be next to each other, if not connected. We ended up having our children's room 3 doors down and only 1 room was available when we checked-in around 3pm. The rooms were very nice. Our children's room was standard but our room was very spacious with a little sitting area. The management even sent a box of chocolate and a bottle of wine to our room, since my husband has elite status. A very nice touch. The bathroom was also very clean and nice, bed was very comfortable. Our room came with complimentary rooftop breakfast, but our children did not get that and we were not willing to shell out 30 euros each, so we took turn to eat breakfast. The rooftop restaurant was very pleasant, with a great view. There were plenty of food but we did not find the breakfast food of very high quality. There was a swarm of ants near one of the juice dispensers, kind of disgusting over the crisp and super white linens. We ate outside at the terrace and for a second we were away to get something, a big seagull came zooming down to grab our food. So, make sure at least 1 person sitting at the table if you still want the food. I found the location not very desirable. It is true that the hotel is near 2 metro stations. However, metro stop Barberiini is a bit of a climb back to the Hotel and metro stop Spagna is a long walk through the tunnel to/from the Spanish Steps, very quiet at night. If we have to pay for the hotel, we probably prefer to stay a bit closer to action. I would recommend this hotel to a friend if he/she can stay with points. If they have to pay, there are other choices, provided the Grand Flora is not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel, but no business center”
Reviews.Author: Liron B
Reviews.Content: must remember when you go to Europe that the hotels will be much smaller than those in the US.. the hotel is very nice and the rooms are a decent size.. the bathrooms are very clean and well kept.. the beds, though, are hard and uncomfortable, as are the bed sheets.. the internet access in room and throughout the hotel is free, but make sure to ask for an access code for the length of your trip when you check in.. the business center is practically non-existent (two computers) and the printers take ages to print just one page.. this hotel would be fine for non-business travelers, esp for the location..

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed in the Grand Flora”
Reviews.Author: CharlieFolsom
Reviews.Content: When we checked in they gave us a smoking room and we had to change. The desk was very accomodating in making the change. The Marriott staff was adequate. We were disappointed in the staff in the roof top terrace for breakfast. Lengthy waits for food, and not all of it arrived together. Had to wait for other items which took away from an enjoyable dining experience. The view was great. We arrived in Rome after a week in Paris. The hotel service in Paris was outstanding the hotel service in Rome was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, superb staff”
Reviews.Author: luvtripsl
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, the hotel staff was very friendly despite us walking in with our large packs, and being sweaty and tired after 2 days of travel. We were backpacking across Europe and Rome was our first stop so we decided to stay with a hotel brand we trusted for our first few nights. We put directions on our iPhone from the airport to train station to hotel and we had no trouble finding it. It was a little further from the Metro than we would have liked since we were planning on walking most everywhere. We walked to the hotel from the Barbarini station (the scenic route) but if you follow the signs for Villa Borghese (in the Metro) you'll walk a lot underground but you'll pop out right across the street from the hotel. The hotel staff/concierge was great helping us find a laundromat, travel agent to book our train tickets for the rest of our trip and all the sights. We called a taxi to the hotel once and then discovered that the Taxi's wait on the road right next to the hotel and it's cheaper to just go get the taxi there since they start charging when they get the call from the hotel. We felt the room size was not small despite other reviews. Our room was pretty large but the bathroom was small. The furnishings did have an older feel to them and perhaps could be updated but still gave a charming feel for a hotel in such an ancient city. We had breakfast on the rooftop one morning. Not sure it was completely worth the cost, the view of St. Peter's isn't as close as it looks on the Marriott website and the food wasn't that great. The "roasted potatoes" on the menu are actually french fries! The hotel staff was amazing, we were super impressed with everyone, especially housekeeping!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, small room”
Reviews.Author: PinguinVA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Flora using Marriott Reward points. The hotel is located on the Via Veneto, which is a nice, upscale part of the city not too far from the Spanish Steps. There are lots of restaurants nearby, which is an advantage. Also less than 10 minute walk to the nearest subway. The hotel itself is nicer than a typical Marriott in some ways (e.g. a very nice, comfortable lobby and a somewhat grand exterior). I'm not sure if my room was small because I was using points, but it was definitely smaller than what I've experienced in other Marriotts in Europe. The bed was not up to Marriott standards -- very hard with flimsy pillows. The furnishings could also use some updating. Still, all in all, you would probably be quite happy using this hotel as your base in Rome. I can't comment on the value since we were using points, but like Marriotts virtually anywhere, it is a dependable, reliable location with American-type amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, old world charm in a lovely location”
Reviews.Author: annkr
Reviews.Content: We were only able to book two consecutive nights with Marriott points, so we arrived by taxi from another Rome hotel. The taxi driver looked puzzled when I said Marriott Grand Flora, but Grand Flora alone brought smiles of recognition, and a direct drive to the hotel. We had previously been in Paris for a week at the Marriott Champs Elysees, so we were expecting a great hotel, and first impression of the elegant lobby and efficient reception fulfilled that assumption. Our room at first glance did not have give the impression of luxury that we had anticipated, but it was a large corner room with windows on Via Veneto and on the street to the right of the hotel. We had a great walk-in closet, spacious entry way and lovely bathroom, and by the end of the first day, I was totally sold on the Grand Flora. We walked almost everywhere, using the metro only once to bring us back to the hotel on a hot afternoon after wandering far afield. We loved the cafes and gelaterias, and had breakfast at the charming little bar/pastry shop/deli/gelateria just down the street. (first cafe on the right side of the street to the right of the hotel as you face the hotel) and at the Caffe de Oro, near the Pantheon, where they just may, indeed, have the best coffee in the world. Our laptop loved the high speed internet. Although it was not wireless, the hotel provided us with the necessary cable, and it was fast and free. The concierge was quite helpful in locating a small, unlisted restaurant recommended by a neighbor's family who live in Rome part of the year, and though we had great food everywhere, one of our favorites was Hosteria Costanza, near Campo de Fiori, built into the walls of the ancient Teatro de Pompeo. We have plans to go back to Rome soon, and hope we'll have enough points left to stay again at the Grand Flora. Although we would not pay $$$$ to stay at the Grand Flora, we do consider it an excellent use of our points, and were quite pleased with our brief stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra-Luxurious!!”
Reviews.Author: pmeuro
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 nights at the Marriott Grand Flora, on points. I am a Marriott platinum member, and was able to get upgraded to an Executive Suite through the help of a Marriott employee. I have never stayed is such a grand and large suite, and everything about it spelled high class. Worthy of 5+ stars! The location was perfect - next to the gardens and to 2 metro stations. One of the stations has an underground pathway with an entrance next to the hotel. The pathway also houses a supermarket store, which is very convenient. We mostly used the other metro station, as it was a nice downhill walk from the hotel. Some people mentioned that the restaurants close to the hotel are very expensive. I would disagree, although it depends on what you call expensive. There is a mix of mid-to-high end restaurants. We did not eat at the super expensive lounges, but some of the restaurants and pizzerias were reasonably priced, given the high-end locality. We walked to the Spanish steps and to trevi fountains area from the hotel during the evenings. Both were close by and the walk was pleasant. Breakfast was included in our reservation, and it was excellent! Great variety and selection of breads, eggs, juices, pastries, etc. Fantastic views of the city from the roof-top. I doubt you can get a better selection of continental breakfast and view of the city from any other hotel. Unlike other reviews, I found the staff extremely client focused and helpful. We sought help from the staff on a number of occasions for locations, recommendations, directions, etc. and were provided with good insights and suggestions. I forgot my laptop plug-point adapter in Florence, and they lent me one free to charge. The only downside of the hotel was that our room had a couple of small televisions, while I would have expected suites to come with large plasma/lcd screens. Not a big deal, but it should be a small thing for them to fix. We would not have stayed here if we had to pay out of pocket, but would certainly suggest it to anyone planning to use points. It does not get better than this!

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable Italian vacation”
Reviews.Author: travelhappyNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 21/2 week family vacation to Italy. We divided our time between Rome and Sorrento.....perfect balance! We used Marriott points and stayed at the Grand Flora on the Via Veneto during our time in Rome. This was a beautiful, classic hotel. Our room was on the fourth floor and overlooked the Via Veneto, with a perfect view of the ancient city wall. The room was large and very clean, with classic (antique like) furnishings. The bed was not the Marriott bed that we are used to in the US but it was very comfortable. My only real complaint is with the size of the bathroom....very small. Due to our Marriott status we were upgraded to include breakfast every morning which is served in the rooftop restaurant. Breakfast was wonderful, the wait staff was so pleasant (even at 6:30am!) and the view was spectacular....it was the perfect start to every day. The hotel is in a very good location. We are a very active family and walked just about everywhere. When we did use the metro we got off at Piazza Barberini rather than Spagna because we didn't like the long underground walk required to get to the Spagna station. No matter what hour we returned home we always felt very safe walking on the street. I do agree with others who have posted here...the hotel is very pricey...but if you have the points use them and enjoy!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “As Luxurious As Its Going to Get!”
Reviews.Author: DanielleCiccone
Reviews.Content: Just amazing....top to bottom, gorgeous hotel, security at night. Delicious breakfast on the roof in the AM. Its Europe, so the rooms are small. Dont expect to stay in a large suite it may be a Marriot, but its still in Rome. Small Rooms VERY clean though. Gorgeous bathrooms. Located on Via Venetto which is very popular with the nicer hotels and restaurants. Although not my favorite restaurants on the strip. Very commercial. Another great thing about this Hotel is it is located across from Villa Borghese which I a beautiful Park, if you get a decent room, you may have an amazing view.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but it seems to be a bit over valued.”
Reviews.Author: jimftn
Reviews.Content: I will stay again but not at peak prices. Location is very convient if you don't mind walks of up to 2 miles.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Gratefulforvacations
Reviews.Content: We stayed using all our Marriott points. If we had paid outright, we would have been outraged. The hotel is incredibly overpriced for what you get. The room was large for a European room, but there were stains on some of the furniture and there was no view from our room. The service was minimal at best (see below). As for the location, it is right across from the Borghese park, which is lovely, but it is not close to anything else. We would suggest staying closer to the main sights. We went to the rooftop for cappucino in the morning and the view was very nice. Do not buy the breakfast, unless it is included in your package. It is very overpriced. We returned to our room at 2:30 for a rest after touring in the heat, and the room was not ready for us. We were told that it would be available soon, but it took them an hour (after multiple reminders) to get it ready. Although they tried to make it up to us (after the hour) offering a free breakfast (which we could not avail ourselves of because of an early flight) and then a room upgrade (why didn't they offer that earlier?), which we turned down because we didn't want to take the time packing and unpacking. They sent up a bottle of wine and some chocolates a little later. I guess they tried, but we would have just preferred the room availability when we returned. When we asked about transfers to the airport, the concierge offered a private car and then when we said that we had paid half that amount to get to Rome from the airport, he said we could get a cab which has flat rates to the airport. We would not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luxuriousness”
Reviews.Author: corruptlawyer
Reviews.Content: If you have points to cash in or lots of cash to spend, this hotel will exceed your expectations. We stayed for a city break to see the sights - our regular double was amazingly plush and the staff extremely helpful in recommending resturants off the tourist trail and securing reservations. As we prioritized sightseeing, we didn't make use of the facilities but would love to return some time.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Points or Bust!”
Reviews.Author: SkinnieBunnie
Reviews.Content: We paid for this room with Marriott points or there is no way we could have afforded it. It was really expensive. But, they knew it was our honeymoon. They upgraded us to an AMAZING junior suite (with a patio that was bigger than the livingroom in our apartment!), and we had a very nice note and bottle of champagne waiting for us. They were super cool with us being in Rome for the first time. They helped us with places to eat and how long of walk things were, etc. The hotel restaurant was too expensive for our blood. 22 bucks on average for breakfast if I remember right. But the hotel is beautiful, quite, and fabulous! And the location is awesome. It is in a rich part of town, low crime, near famous hot spots, and if you are seriously craving American food and serving sizes, the Hard Rock is walking distance. This is a hotel the celebrities stay in apparently. Laaa-te-da! We stayed there because the location was close enough that we walked/hiked to the colussium from there. Not a short walk, but certainly do-able if you're in decent shape. Note it was November, this might not be true in the Summer heat.

Reviews.Title: “Vintage Marriott Service”
Reviews.Author: spacatutto
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Flora is a very nice hotel. It's a little pricey however consider the money you will save by not having to take a taxi ANYWHERE except the Vatican. Service was very excellent, friendly staff etc. I would suggest eating at restaurants off Via Veneto not because they are less expensive but because ther are so many great restuarants off the main Via. If you are a frequent traveler and are familar witrh Marriot's level of service you will not be disappointed. I also would recommend to shop for snacks and beverages down the escalator accross the street it will save you alot of $$$. AMM.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Service-bad gym”
Reviews.Author: khar17
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Rome after being in Venice and Florence. We were greeted by Allesandro who could not have treated us any better. He was pleasant, helpful and gave great recommendations. The location of the hotel is perfect, being right at the entrance to the Borghese Gardens and near the metro stop. We were given a great room with a view of the park. We used Marriot points, but since it was a Category 8 hotel, we used a lot of them. The breakfast buffet outside on the roof was very good and the view was spectacular. The only problem, which seems to be the same everywhere is that the fitness are offered very little.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice experience”
Reviews.Author: cmendla
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at the Flora. The location is terrific. You can walk to a lot of the attractions. (albeit a long walk). Right outside the hotel is a portal for the 1800 year old Aurelian Wall. Across the street is the Villa Borghese. The staff throught the hotel provided excellent and friendly service. There are tons of sidewalk restaurants in the area. One tip - Across the street you will find an escalator down to an underground level. Actually, it is two escalators. If you take that and walk a couple of hundred yards, you will find a complete supermarket underground. This is a great place to get some snacks , water and even a bottle of vino for your room. We found the rooms to be decent. The bathroom was a bit small in our first room but part of that is due to the bidet. Breakfast on the rooftop is a great experience. You can see the vatican and other landmarks (bring binoculars if you can) When we were leaving, our flight had to return for an emergency landing due to a cracked windshield. The airline tried to put us up in what they claimed was a four star hotel in Ostia. that place was a dump. We called the Flora and they confirmed they had a room available. Unfortunately, the limo service they use didn't have any available cars but we were able to find a limo on our own. Summary. If we go back to Rome, we will most likely make the Flora our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Some room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: SingaporePete
Reviews.Content: We were given a room on the first floor, and it was noisy beyond tolerable levels. Hot water did not run in the late morning (around 10 a.m.) when I took showers on the first two days we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Rooms Need Refurbish”
Reviews.Author: Miasig
Reviews.Content: 3rd stay at Marriott since 2000. Rooms not really updated since then, getting a little tired. Room are smallish, required by hotel to get 3 rooms for family of six. Location is fantastic, easy walk to Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon and short cab rides to all other major sites. Front Desk very helpful. Breakfast so so for price, go around corner of hotel on left side to first street, go 25 feet to cafeon right there for great coffee, pastries, lite lunch and geltato. Hotel now allows limited point award stay which compared to $ US 450 per night is way to go. Concierege dinner recommnedations usually overpriced busts.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and Rome”
Reviews.Author: Papad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and loved the location and the service. My husband is platinum with marriott and we stayed here on points. It is pretty pricey but worth it for me since I am somewhat of a hotel snob. The breakfast at the rooftop terrace was amazing. The choice were good but the view was marvelous. The hotel is within walking distance to a lot of sights. You can walk to Spanish steps (I highly recommend walking there, it's just lively and beautiful), Borghese gardens are just next door and the Trevi fountain is not a bad walk eiher. The hop on hop off tour left accross from the Savoy hotel which is also a block away. There were many places to eat but our favorite was San Marco, a local joint that the Conceirge recommended. It was friendly, casual and great food. We also took a day trip to Capri and a trip to the Vatican that the Conceirge helped with and that was great as well. Overall Rome is really really beautiful and the people I found very friendly and most people spoke good English. I highly recommend the hotel if you can get a room there on points (it's actually pretty hard to get room there on points) or if you can afford to pay the high price. To me it's worth the money when you are there for a short time and are looking for a nice hotel in a great location .

Reviews.Title: “Great introduction to Rome, Italy”
Reviews.Author: RobReno
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome and we wanted to stay someplace nice. Marriott Grand Flora is very nice. We stayed using points and were upgraded to a Jr. Suite - very, very nice. Hotel is in great upscale location. Plenty to do within walking distance. Good selection of restaurants in area. Metro station not too far. The Jr. Suite was a good size bedroom and comfortable living/sitting room. Roof restaurant for breakfast was closed, but looked like a great place to start the day. You can see the Vatican from the roof. Doorman was very helpful with directions, taxis, etc. Internet service provided free.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, courteous and helpful staff, good location.”
Reviews.Author: AJL76
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Rome was greatly enhanced by the friendly and helpful staff of this hotel. We arrived at nine am on Friday morning and were able to check in early, which allowed us to freshen up and enjoy a full day in Rome. The concierge and staff all spoke English and helped us with directions to all of our meeting points in a prompt and friendly manner. They also made arrangements for our transportation to and from the hotel. The hotel is beautiful and clean. Our room, a junior suite, was comfortable and the bathroom well appointed with linens and supplies. The shower water pressure was outstanding! Internet connection was conveniently available in both our room and the main lobby. A wonderful place to stay for an American's first trip to Rome. My only complaint would be the loud noise of a truck that awoke us two days in a row at around 6am coming from the streeet adjacent to our room.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 star - Out dated rooms, but great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: HudsoBurrito
Reviews.Content: Even by European standards this hotel is not a 5 star. Yes, if you want a big room on the most expensive street in Rome, then book here. The rooms and bedding are outdated and old. The beds were uncomfortable, no covers, and the bathroom was small (not unexpected in EU). If you want location and "comfort", then go to the InterContinetal at the top of the Spanish Steps. The rooms are smaller, but the bedding is cozy comfort and the bathrooms are much bigger (Rm 123 is great!), or ask for a room with a view of the inner courtyard. The only saving grace at the Marriott is the breakfast buffet, that was included because of my status. And Sonya the front desk lady that works the evening shift.
